column14: Mobile Apps, Software, Cyber Security, Sports, E-commerce, Mass Distribution
column28:
DECATHLON DIGITAL is the power engine of DECATHLON transformation. With the expertise of over 4 000 teammates based in Lille, Paris, and Amsterdam, committed to creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences, and product second life.

At DECATHLON DIGITAL, weâ€™re transforming global digital sports experiences to elevate how customers and employees sustainably play, train, and connect in more than 70 countries.
column57:
Introduction

Decathlon is accelerating its transformation to become THE digital sports platform. We want to give our clients the opportunity to discover our universe through multidimensional experiences around sport. Our goal is to create an open ecosystem to connect third-party players and services in a secure and optimal way.

Join the Digital In Store - Data team and help us revolutionize Decathlonâ€™s in-store activities.We provide insights to digital teams and contribute to make our in-store tool ecosystem better. We enable our internal users to have a stronger business impact and operational performance through the use of data and innovative solutions.

We are hiring a senior Data Analyst for an internal position based in Paris, Lille, Amsterdam.

Your Roles as Senior Data Analyst

  • Build scalable analytic frameworks to generate insights for Decathlonâ€™s Instore Ecosystem such as store performance, efficiency, automation, experience, checkout and staffing.
  • Design, drive and analyze results of experiments such as in store A/B tests and causal Inferences.
  • Partner with key stakeholders such as Product Managers, Business Managers, Engineers and Data Managers to be able to qualify their needs and translate them into relevant data analysis.
  • Drive analytics studies to improve Decathlonâ€™s understanding of customer in store behaviors and potential organization strategy via tooling, staffing, automation & robotisation etc.
  • Identify and quantify opportunities for new business and product development; Turn business and product problems into actionable insights.
  • Mentor junior data analysts and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives skills youâ€™ll need to bring.

Skills youâ€™ll need to bring

  • 3-7+ years of relevant industry experience working in tech platform, consulting or scaled retail environments.
  • Background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Data Science.
  • You speak fluent English and French
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, Python and statistics is a must ; Data visualization experience with Tableau is preferred; advanced analytical and machine learning knowledge is a plus.
  • You want to join a company with a positive impact (#Tech4Good)

Nice to have

  • Experience with causal inference is a plus
  • Experience with Retail is a bonus

Benefits

  • 2 days of remote work per week (of your choosing)
  • Work from one of Decathlon Technology's offices in Lille or Paris.
  • Choose your laptop (Mac, Windows, Chromebooks)
  • Local project team and sharing with global network (international mobility)
  • Constant learning and mentorship (large diversity of projects, language and technologies, certification, events)
  • Possibility of certification from the first year (AWS, GCP, etc.)
  • Internal and external training
  • Employee shareholding plan
  • Monthly and quarterly bonus

About Decathlon Digital

What if tech allowed us to reinvent the sport of tomorrow and become the largest digital sports platform? This is the goal we set ourselves at Decathlon.

â€œMaking the pleasures and benefits of sport accessible to as many people as possible over the long termâ€ has always been our mission. A vocation that today reaches its climax by increasing the experience of sport through technology and meeting the needs of our 500 million users around the world.

We are thus creating new experiences for athletes â€“ virtual coaching, loyalty programs, smart in-store experiences, new and second-hand product offers, as well as rental services for a wide range of Decathlon and partner products.

Decathlon Digital now has more than 5000 technical profiles: software engineers, product managers, data, Cloud and cybersecurity experts, in France and abroad, based in Paris, Lille, Nantes and Lyon, London, Madrid, Berlin and Amsterdam.

Decathlon is committed to inclusion and non-discrimination, and thus acts daily in favor of disability, seniors, social diversity, equality between women and men. Above all, we recruit personalities and diversity within our teams because it is a source of innovation and performance.

If you want to know more about our commitments, you can consult this link.

DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT

What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. Together, we are creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences and product second life.

Changing the game for good. We are in this for the love of sports. And like everything we love, we want it to last. Thatâ€™s why we are embarking on a journey to create a more sustainable tech model, reducing our direct environmental impact while maintaining a safe, diverse, and inclusive space for all our people to learn and thrive together. Team up with us to design the digital future of sports.

At DECATHLON DIGITAL, weâ€™re transforming global digital sports experiences to elevate how customers and employees sustainably play, train, and connect in more than 70 countries.

DECATHLON DIGITAL is the power engine of DECATHLON transformation. column45: Rue de la Centenaire, 59170 Croix, France
column46: Rue de la Centenaire, 59170 Croix, France
column57:
Introduction

Decathlon is accelerating its transformation to become THE digital sports platform. We want to give our clients the opportunity to discover our universe through multidimensional experiences around sport. Our goal is to create an open ecosystem to connect third-party players and services in a secure and optimal way.

Join the Digital In Store - Data team and help us revolutionize Decathlonâ€™s in-store activities.We provide insights to digital teams and contribute to make our in-store tool ecosystem better. We enable our internal users to have a stronger business impact and operational performance through the use of data and innovative solutions.

We are hiring a senior Data Analyst for an internal position based in Paris, Lille, Amsterdam.

Your Roles as Senior Data Analyst

  • Build scalable analytic frameworks to generate insights for Decathlonâ€™s Instore Ecosystem such as store performance, efficiency, automation, experience, checkout and staffing.
  • Design, drive and analyze results of experiments such as in store A/B tests and causal Inferences.
  • Partner with key stakeholders such as Product Managers, Business Managers, Engineers and Data Managers to be able to qualify their needs and translate them into relevant data analysis.
  • Drive analytics studies to improve Decathlonâ€™s understanding of customer in store behaviors and potential organization strategy via tooling, staffing, automation & robotisation etc.
  • Identify and quantify opportunities for new business and product development; Turn business and product problems into actionable insights.
  • Mentor junior data analysts and contribute to continuous improvement initiatives skills youâ€™ll need to bring.

Skills youâ€™ll need to bring

  • 3-7+ years of relevant industry experience working in tech platform, consulting or scaled retail environments.
  • Background in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Econometrics, Mathematics, Data Science.
  • You speak fluent English and French
  • Strong knowledge of SQL, Python and statistics is a must ; Data visualization experience with Tableau is preferred; advanced analytical and machine learning knowledge is a plus.
  • You want to join a company with a positive impact (#Tech4Good)

Nice to have

  • Experience with causal inference is a plus
  • Experience with Retail is a bonus

Benefits

  • 2 days of remote work per week (of your choosing)
  • Work from one of Decathlon Technology's offices in Lille or Paris.
  • Choose your laptop (Mac, Windows, Chromebooks)
  • Local project team and sharing with global network (international mobility)
  • Constant learning and mentorship (large diversity of projects, language and technologies, certification, events)
  • Possibility of certification from the first year (AWS, GCP, etc.)
  • Internal and external training
  • Employee shareholding plan
  • Monthly and quarterly bonus

About Decathlon Digital

What if tech allowed us to reinvent the sport of tomorrow and become the largest digital sports platform? This is the goal we set ourselves at Decathlon.

â€œMaking the pleasures and benefits of sport accessible to as many people as possible over the long termâ€ has always been our mission. A vocation that today reaches its climax by increasing the experience of sport through technology and meeting the needs of our 500 million users around the world.

We are thus creating new experiences for athletes â€“ virtual coaching, loyalty programs, smart in-store experiences, new and second-hand product offers, as well as rental services for a wide range of Decathlon and partner products.

Decathlon Digital now has more than 5000 technical profiles: software engineers, product managers, data, Cloud and cybersecurity experts, in France and abroad, based in Paris, Lille, Nantes and Lyon, London, Madrid, Berlin and Amsterdam.

Decathlon is committed to inclusion and non-discrimination, and thus acts daily in favor of disability, seniors, social diversity, equality between women and men. Above all, we recruit personalities and diversity within our teams because it is a source of innovation and performance.

If you want to know more about our commitments, you can consult this link.

DECATHLON DIGITAL CONTEXT

What if technology allowed us to push the boundaries and take sports experiences to new levels? That's exactly our goal at Decathlon Digital! We are a team of 5,000+ experts in software engineering, product management, data, cloud, and cybersecurity, distributed across Paris, Lille, and Amsterdam. Together, we are creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences and product second life.

Changing the game for good. We are in this for the love of sports. And like everything we love, we want it to last. Thatâ€™s why we are embarking on a journey to create a more sustainable tech model, reducing our direct environmental impact while maintaining a safe, diverse, and inclusive space for all our people to learn and thrive together. Team up with us to design the digital future of sports.

Do you know Tinder, Meetic, Disons Demain, Match? That's us!

The Meetic Group is today the European leader in dating services and is present in 16 countries.

At the origin of more than 8 million couples, Meetic works to create the best user experience whether online, mobile or at the many events organised each week across Europe.

As a company on a human scale, backed by the strength of an international group, our teams develop products with a strong social impact.

In recent years, Meetic has placed people and the environment at the centre of its concerns through concrete actions: such as ISO 14001 certification (Environmental Management System Certification), WFH Expense, 1 month's Second Parent leave.

column57:
The position:

Meetic relies heavily on data to manage its activities, and is constantly developing the use of this asset. In this context, the Data & Analytics team is at the crossroads of key developments.

Our mission is to design tomorrow's dating app to satisfy our millions of monthly users.

Our stack: SQL, Spark, Advanced Excel, Qlikview, PowerBI, VBA, Python, Presto, Google Suite

Join Claire, Marie, Margaux and Thibault in the Data & Analytics team for your next journey:

- Blossom within an agile, stimulating, young and dynamic working environment.

- Evolve as part of a team in constant communication with all departments of our company.

- Make daily progress in a vast data ecosystem that enables us to intervene in all areas of our business: marketing, acquisition, customer experience, pricing, business model optimization, fraud prevention and much more.

- Take part in improving analysis practices and challenge existing processes.

- Challenge your creativity by taking part in our hackathons.

Your daily missions:

- Business Partner:

With the help of team analysts, identify the best performance indicators and help monitor them.Â 

Carry out analyses and communicate conclusions.

Increase the analytical maturity of people you collaborate with

- Analytics engineer :

Implement the best response to a data need.

Use advanced mathematical methods with the help of data scientists.

Collaborate continuously with IT teams to guarantee data availability.

- Project manager support :

Support the team's data analysts on large-scale projects in line with the company's rhythm.

Help coordinate the various collaborators involved (internal and external).

Participate in communication on progress, risks and achievement of objectives.

Qualifications:

You have a degree in engineering or a Master's in mathematics/computer science, and you are fluent in English. You enjoy discovering new scientific methods and challenging existing ones. You keep in mind the purpose of your work: to facilitate business decisions.

- You have a good command of SQL or are curious enough to learn it quickly.

- You have excellent analytical, synthesis and communication skills.

- We count on your technical skills and rigorous scientific approach, which we'll be able to develop together.

- Working with Excel and Powerpoint doesn't scare you

- You're curious, creative, proactive and open-minded; you have ideas and share them.

- You have a good command of written and spoken English.

Nice-to-have skills:

- PL/SQL programming

- Mastery of Qlikview or other BI tools

- Programming in VBA, R, Python

- Advanced knowledge of mathematics/statistics

What we offer:

- Operate in an international and multicultural environment

- A gorgeous working environment in the heart of Paris, spacious and modern office, rooftop, close to transport and amenities

- Many quality moments of sharing: office activities, summer party, team buildings

- Competitive package in line with the market

- Enjoy work-life balance

- Edenred lunch vouchers

- Classpass gym discounts

- Premium healthcare coverage with WTW

- Use our products free of charge

Hiring Process:

A first 30-min Zoom conversation with Guillaume (Recruiter)

A 90-min onsite meeting including a live use case with Claire (Data & Analytics Director)

A 30-min Zoom meeting with Marie (Payment Data Analyst Manager)

A final 60-min onsite or Zoom interview with Marc (Sr. Director Finance & Analytics) and Belinda (Sr People Manager)

On your initial days, the HR Team and your team will make sure you start under excellent conditions.

Practical information:

Contract start: As soon as you are ready!

Location: 53 Rue de ChÃ¢teaudun, Paris 75009

Work From Home Policy: Hybrid, between 2 and 3 days at the office per week required

Contract: CDI / Full Time

Meetic is an employer that respects equal opportunities and diversity.

column28:
Didomi helps organizations implement great Privacy User Experiences that respect choices and give people control over their data.

Our Global Privacy UX Solutions are designed to solve todayâ€™s data privacy challenges, such as multi-regulation consent management, privacy governance, and the need to provide self-service user privacy journeys, supercharged by flexible integrations, high-grade security standards, and premium support services.

Thousands of companies work with Didomi to collect billions of consent and preference data points, monitor vendor and tracker activity, reduce compliance risk, and engage their users with highly personalized, privacy-first experiences that build trust and loyalty.

column57:
What we're looking for

We are seeking a highly skilled and experienced Senior Data Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will possess advanced analytical skills, a deep understanding of SQL, and a knack for deriving valuable insights from complex datasets. Additionally, they should have foundational knowledge of engineering principles, including Git and scripting, and experience with tools like dbt and Snowflake.

Responsibilities

Data Analysis & Insights:

Analyze large and complex datasets to extract actionable insights.

Identify and propose new metrics and data-driven insights to add value to the company and our customers.

Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs).

SQL & Query Optimization:

Write advanced SQL queries to manipulate and analyze data.

Ensure queries are optimized for performance and scalability.

Stakeholder Collaboration:

Work closely with stakeholders across various departments to understand their data needs and provide relevant insights.

Translate business requirements into technical specifications and data models.

Walk through complex topics with non-technical stakeholders

Team

Mentor more junior data analysts

Ability to see the big picture and align the strategy to business goals

Qualifications

Experience:

Minimum of 7 years of experience in a data analyst or related role.

Proven experience in writing and optimizing complex SQL queries.

Previous experience with dbt and Snowflake is highly desirable.

Excellent written and spoken English

Technical Skills:

Mastery of SQL for data analysis and query optimization.

Proficient in data visualization tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI, Looker).

Experience with data warehousing solutions.

Basic engineering skills, including Git and scripting languages (e.g., Python, Bash) are a plus.

Soft Skills:

Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.

Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.

Ability to work collaboratively with cross-functional teams.

Attention to detail and a passion for data-driven decision-making.

Our Technology Stack

We process billions of events every day. Our data team relies heavily on Snowflake, dbt, and Fivetran to provide an easy-to-use platform for querying and graphing events. Weâ€™re in the process of choosing our BI tool to replace the legacy stack (Cluvio/Redash), we would love to hear what you recommend and why!

Our pipelines are orchestrated via Airflow, and our code and CI are managed in Gitlab.

Our Vision as a Team

We are building an engineering team committed to delivering high-quality products and code. We believe in automation to ensure consistent quality, rapid development, and we take pride in our work.

At Didomi, we are organized into feature teams and prioritize minimizing unnecessary meetings. Our engineering team works remotely from around the world, with a requirement for a 4-hour overlap with CET working hours.

We rely on automated testing (unit, integration, linters, etc.) and continuous integration/delivery to build flexible applications that evolve without breaking. This approach allows engineers to focus on code quality and iterate quickly. When we encounter issues, we fix them and learn from our experiences.

Why Join Didomi?

Remote Work Flexibility: Work from anywhere with a 4-hour overlap with CET.

Professional Growth: Opportunities to learn and grow within a supportive team.

Innovative Environment: Work with cutting-edge technologies and tools.

Collaborative Culture: Be part of a team that values quality, automation, and continuous improvement.

Hiring process

An intro call with HR

A technical interview with the engineering manager of the data team

Team Interview: SQL whiteboarding session, discussion on modeling, design and data management with a few members of the team

A series of 1:1 with the team

They provide their massive community of 23 million members worldwide, with the best customer experience, from product discovery, buyer-seller interactions, platform safety to delivery, thanks to their knowledgeable curation/authentication/quality control and tech teams (Data scientists, DevOps, Android Developersâ€¦)

column57:
Vestiaire Collective is the leading global online marketplace for desirable pre-loved fashion. Our mission is to transform the fashion industry for a more sustainable future by empowering our community to promote the circular fashion movement. Vestiaire was founded in 2009 and is headquartered in Paris with offices in London, Berlin, New York, Singapore, Ho Chi Minh and Hong Kong and warehouses in Tourcoing (France), Crawley (UK), Hong Kong and New York.

We currently have a diverse global team of 700 employees representing more than 50 nationalities. Our values are Activism, Transparency, Dedication and Greatness and Collective. We are proud to be a BCorp.

About the role ğŸ–¥ï¸

As a Data Product Analyst, you will play a key role in the future of Vestiaire Collective. You will report directly to the Head of Data Products and work closely with the VP of Product, defining KPIs, creating dashboards and analyzing data to generate hypotheses and identify growth opportunities. Your responsibilities will extend to collaborating actively with the Finance and Business Performance teams. You will help measure and project the financial impact of Product & Tech initiatives, ensuring alignment with our company's strategic objectives.

Our teams currently work remotely on Wednesdays and also have 3 flexible remote working days to choose from every month.

What youâ€™ll doğŸ‘œ

  • Ensure the proper definition and monitoring of the team KPIs.Â 
  • Collaborate with the Finance & Business Performance teams to link these KPIs with business outcomes.
  • Define key user actions to be tracked to ensure we are able to analyze their behavior and make sound decisions to improve the User Experience
  • Data querying and analysis, supporting the tribe in providing actionable data insights
  • Create reports & dashboards for communicating insights to stakeholders
  • Work on A/B test setup and analysis to validate core hypotheses and assess the impact of product changes.
  • Stakeholder management and facilitation of data-driven decision making.

    • Who you areâ­

  • Bachelor degree in Statistics / Economy/Business (with focus on data and informatics) / Engineering or related field
  • At least 3 year of professional work experience analyzing product or user behavior
  • Strong SQL knowledge with experience in querying large, complex data sets. Python/R knowledge is a plus
  • Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques, familiarity with experimentation
  • Experience with reporting and data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, Looker, Qlik, etc. - Tableau is an advantage
  • Passionate about the fashion/luxury industry
  • Experience working in ecommerce is a plus

    • What we offer ğŸ

    A meaningful job with an impact on the way people consume fashion and promote sustainability

    The opportunity to do career-defining work in a fast-growing French-born scale up

    The possibility to work as part of a globally diverse team with more than 50 nationalitiesÂ 

    Two days to help Project - reinforcing your activist journey and volunteer for an association

    Significant investment in your learning and growth

    Competitive compensation and benefits package

    As full member of our entrepreneurial project, you will be eligible to free shares

    Surveys show that women and members of underrepresented communities only apply for a job if they meet 100% of the required conditions. Does this sound like you? If so, Vestiaire Collective encourages you to reconsider your application. We look forward to receiving your application!

    Vestiaire Collective is an equal opportunities employerÂ Â

column28:
Sorare is at the intersection of sports, gaming and NFTs. Through tradable digital cards, Sorare is designing a collective fantasy sport experience where you can manage your favorite Football, Baseball and Basketball players, hone your passion to earn prizes and be part of a community. Anyone, anywhere, can connect with the game on Sorare. The companyâ€™s mission is to build â€œthe game within the gameâ€ and to give fans, players and clubs the platform to celebrate, share and own the game.

Founded in 2018, Sorare has seen tremendous growth. The platform had a card sales volume of over $300M (â‚¬270M) since January 2021 across 160 countries. Sorare is backed by a world-class team of investors including Softbank, Benchmark, Accel Partners, footballers such as Gerard PiquÃ©, Antoine Griezmann and Rio Ferdinand, and key tech investors such as Alexis Ohanian.
column45: Rue de la Victoire, 75009 Paris, France
column46: Rue de la Victoire, 75009 Paris, France
column57:
At Sorare, we bet on passionate and innovative people! Are you looking for an empowering environment to grow professionally and personally? Join us in this tremendous adventure!

Our Mission

Sorare is a fantasy sports gaming experience and marketplace featuring officially licensed digital player cards. With Sorare you build legacy teams â€“Â  buying, selling, collecting and trading player cards -- and compete with them in free-to-play fantasy games to win rewards week over week and season over season, just like a professional sports owner.

Sorare is revolutionizing digital sports fandom, and now has over 3,5 million users across 180 countries. More than 300 iconic teams, clubs, and organizations including the Premier League, La Liga, Bundesliga, Serie A, MLS, NBA, NBPA, MLB, MLBPA, and many others have partnered with Sorare to build the next sports entertainment giant.

Our Journey

Sorare was founded by Nicolas Julia and Adrien Montfort in 2018 in Paris to bring sports fans across the globe closer to the players, teams, and leagues they love.

With 130-plus employees across France and US, Sorare is one of Europeâ€™s fastest-growing startups and recently raised a $680 million Series B funding round from world-class investors including SoftBank, Accel, and Benchmark. Sorare also has athletes Serena Williams, Zinedine Zidane, Rio Ferdinand, Antoine Griezmann, Gerard PiquÃ©, Blake Griffin, and Rudy Gobert among its investors, ambassadors, and advisors.

Our Values

  • Own your game: Think and act like an owner, and expect your teammates to do the same. You are an â€œentrepreneurâ€ empowered to make decisions and own the outcomes.

  • Build with the fans, and for the fans: Have an obsession for high-quality user experiences. Engage our community with transparency to build trust and learn from the fans to deliver effective changes.

  • Run fast: Take bold risks and outpace the competition in an ever changing environment. Have a bias for action (connected to team goals) and strive to ship and iterate.

  • Have fun and bring joy: Sports have the power to unite people around the world, and as fans ourselves, we believe it is a privilege to work in this industry.

  • Win as a team: We are all in this together as one team, win or lose. Inspire your teammates to always be better.

As a Product Data Analyst within our Analytics org at Sorare, you will play a pivotal role in supporting our product teams through in-depth analysis, reporting, metric design, and testing and experimentation. You will work closely with cross-functional product teams to derive actionable insights from data, enabling data-driven decision-making to enhance user experience and drive business growth.

As a Product Data Analyst at Sorare, you will :

  • Conduct thorough analysis of user behavior, engagement, and performance metrics.

  • Generate regular reports and dashboards to communicate key insights to product teams.

  • Collaborate with product teams to define and implement relevant KPIs

  • Design and analyze A/B tests and experiments to optimize product features and user flows.

  • Provide recommendations based on experiment results to drive product improvements.

  • Work closely with product managers, engineers, and UX/UI designers to align data insights with product development goals. You will need to communicate findings in a clear and accessible manner to non-technical stakeholders.

  • Collaborate with the data engineering team to optimize data infrastructure.

The ideal candidate:

  • 4+ years of data analysis experience in a product-focused environment

  • BA/BS in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, Economics, or related discipline.

  • Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages (e.g., SQL, Python).

  • Experience with A/B test design, implementation, and measurement

  • Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Looker, Tableau) is a plus.

  • Excellent spoken and written communication skills and the ability to convey complex findings in a clear and understandable way.

  • You are a team player who collaborates with empathy and respect

  • You have an entrepreneurial spirit, demonstrating a proactive approach to problem-solving and decision-making.

The position is located in Paris, FranceÂ 

If youâ€™re passionate about technology, enjoy problem-solving, and thrive in a dynamic environment, we encourage you to apply for this exciting opportunity!

Perks:Â 

  • Health Care: Great medical, dental, and vision insurance coverage fully covered by Sorare

  • Wellness Benefit: Sorare contributes to employees wellness (gym membership and sports classes in our office)

  • Commuter Benefits: Sorare contributes to the cost of your commute with 100% of Navigo pass reimbursedÂ 

  • Latest Tech: Sorare provides equipment such as laptop, monitor, etc.

  • Lunch: Sorare will contribute to their employees lunch vouchersÂ 

  • Time Off: we offer 5 weeks of paid holidays per year in addition to the national holidays and attached RTT.

Our Hiring Process

  • Step 1: Recruiter Screen (30 min)

  • Step 2: Hiring Manager Screen

  • Step 3: Case Study + Panel interviews

  • Step 4: Reference Check & Offer

Sorare is an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive and diverse workplace. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to: race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran status, disability status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

As we are an international company, please note we speak English in the workplace. Please apply for the role with an English CV so we can process your application.

column36: Global Data & Tech Lead | WAVEMAKER F/H
column57:
Data & Technology â€“ Global Data & Tech Lead

About Wavemaker

We believe there always is a better way to grow. We positively provoke growth for our clients by reshaping consumer decision-making and experiences through media, content and technology. The Wavemaker way is globally consistent. Fueled by the worldâ€™s most powerful consumer data, we understand where and how marketing can intervene decisively to help brands win more sales.

Our name is our mission and our method. To make waves, you need to be provocative, even fearless. We do our best work for brave brands and people who want to be challenged to go further and faster. We know itâ€™s not easy, but if itâ€™s in you, we will get it out of you.

Our 7,600 people across 90 markets provoke growth for some of the worldâ€™s leading brands and businesses. Our attitude of Positive Provocation is enabled by:

  • deep knowledge we have of our clientsâ€™ business
  • confidence to challenge whatâ€™s gone before
  • the support to go further than we thought possible

We are a part of GroupM, WPPâ€™s global media investment management company. Discover more on wavemakerglobal.com, Twitter and LinkedIn

Role Purpose:

The purpose of this role is to provide advanced thought-leadership and help drive a strategic vision across our top Agency clients in the realm of data and technology. The Global Data & Tech Lead will have a consultative role across clients to help set 1st, 2nd, 3rd party data strategies, drive and implement technology solutions across media planning, reporting, and optimizing.

The Global Data & Tech Lead will have a sophisticated understanding of both internal and external providers and tools in order to offer consultative advice, roadmaps and solutions.

Working directly with the General Manager and Global Client Leads, this role is responsible for driving our Data & Technology vision across clients, demonstrating best-in-class thought leadership and advancing WPP products and solutions.

Key accountabilities:

  • Work with Agency Leadership to set strategic vision and roadmaps across top clients regarding data, technology, and analytics
  • Partner with Client Leads to drive data strategy, technology solutions, and WPP growth opportunities across top clients
  • Be seen as an expert and leader with top clients to help inform and consult on data and technology solutions (media planning, data-driving marketing strategies, media reporting, analytics, data automatization etc. )
  • Leverage and understand the WPP networkâ€™s solutions and offerings in order to provide best-in-class service and strategies to clients
  • Drive internal stakeholders and product leads to ensure that that our client needs are being met
  • Inspire and lead, fostering a culture of collaboration and innovation to deliver best-in-class data and technology solutions to clients
  • Stay abreast of emerging trends and technologies, evaluating their potential impact and opportunity, and make recommendations for adoption.
  • Strong knowledge and expertise on European Privacy Regulations and their implications on data driven marketing solutions

Key experiences:

  • Broad technical expertise that will inspire and encourage creative, collaborative problem solving.
  • Demonstrated experience in managing senior level clients across media, data, and technology roles
  • Able to navigate seamlessly between setting a strategy and executing/implementing.
  • Strong interpersonal, presentation and negotiating skills.
  • Ability to quickly establish rapport and credibility at all levels including the VP and C-level
  • Ability to understand cultural nuances and adapts own style to fit. Respects differences in culture, approach and skillset
  • Fluent in French and English (written and spoken)
  • Minimum of 10 years of experience in data and technology management

column28:
Getaround is the worldâ€™s leading carsharing platform with a community of over 5 million users sharing thousands of cars in over 300 cities in the United States and Europe.

The Getaround app allows city dwellers who donâ€™t own a car to instantly reserve a vehicle, whether for a few hours or a few days, directly from their smartphone.

Founded in 2009, the startup has experienced very strong growth: it is now present in 8 countries and recently expanded into Europe with the acquisition of car-sharing startups Drivy and Nabobil.

The headquarters are in San Francisco and the team has offices in Paris, London, Berlin, Barcelona, and Oslo.

Getaround has been certified Great place to work in France and Norway, for the year 2022.
column57:
Weâ€™re one of the world's leading carsharing platform, with millions of users around the world, sharing thousands of cars in over 950 cities across 8 countries.

Our mission is simple: Make our cities better places to live through carsharing.

Carsharing empowers people to move in a smarter and more sustainable way: studies show that one shared car replaces between 4 and 10 privately owned cars, which frees up space in our cities while giving communities 24/7 access to cars when they need them.

With our connected car technology, users can quickly and easily book and unlock a wide variety of vehicles directly from our app, without ever having to meet anyone in person, carry an access card, wait in line, or coordinate picking up keys.

To reach our vision of a world where all cars are shared, we need a strong team to help us disrupt car ownership. We look for people who are curious, positive, and engaged; who can adapt and learn quickly; who have the skills and smarts to reach their goals autonomously, while having the generosity and mindset to work collaboratively. No matter your role, background, or level of experience, we believe that every member of the team can have an impact.

Weâ€™re extremely proud to be certified in the â€œBest Workplacesâ€ in 2023 !

The opportunity:

  • You'll belong to an international data team composed of 20 members, and will report to Isaure, our Head of Data Analytics for Demand & Marketing.
  • Youâ€™ll be a key member of our Demand tribe (focusing on our drivers), partnering closely with pricing, growth and product managers to steer the demand side of our business. Youâ€™ll take part in understanding the dynamics in our marketplace to actively contribute to its optimization.Â 
  • As a data analyst, youâ€™ll help build a comprehensive view of our usersâ€™ experience to understand the current challenges and solve complex problems through data. Your analyses will fuel the Demand team with data-backed insights that can have a direct impact on our users and market. Youâ€™ll also be in charge of designing and maintaining data tools to support and empower multiple stakeholders across the company.
  • We invite you to listen to our VP of Data & BIâ€™s podcast with DataGen to better understand how our data organization works.

    • What you'll do:

  • You'll work on cross-functional analytics initiatives end to end:
  • Collaborate with engineers to make sure we structure, collect and process data in an accurate and timely manner.Â You'll own your processing pipelines (SQL) and be responsible for tests and documentation.
  • Conduct exploratory analysis: partner with relevant stakeholders to frame the business problem, deep dive into data to uncover insights, and discuss how to action themShare your recommendations to cross-functional stakeholders, using meaningful reports and visualizations.
  • Design KPIs and monitor their performance towards our objectives.
  • Empower the team by building ground truth data sets and evangelizing data tools to your stakeholders.

    • Example of projects you will work on :

  • Be the analyst for strategic initiatives : monitor the performance of new business linesÂ Provide advanced monitoring and data tools to support our revenue optimization business teams.
  • Help shape the roadmap to evolve our pricing algorithms through exploratory data analysis, data modeling and backtesting.
  • Build tracking specifications and features monitoring plans to monitor the performance of our Product releases.

    • Our stack:

  • Snowflake data warehouse, ELT managed with Airflow and dbt, our own Segment-like integrations, BI/visualization tools such as Tableau and Metabase, Python notebooks in Hex.

    • What you'll bring:

  • 3 to 5 years experience in Data/BI roles in a tech environment.
  • Background in quantitative fields eg Maths, Statistics, Engineering or Business with very strong analytical skills and a willingness to learn more technical skills.
  • A strong interest in product: you think about possible product improvements in your day-to-day interactions with any app
  • Strong ability to turn complex data into actionable insights in a fast-paced environment
  • Strong experience with writing SQL queries, joining large datasets from multiple sources.
  • Experience with Python or other data-oriented programming languages is a strong plus.
  • Attention to detail: you like to understand the fine technicalities of things, and build reliable and resilient data models.
  • Communication: youâ€™re excellent at summarizing any problem and explaining the big picture, both in written and verbal form. You share information proactively.
  • Fluency in English: you can work in English on a daily basis.

    • Would be a strong plus:

  • A prior experience with marketplaces or marketing analytics.
  • Environmental awareness/interest in mobility: interest in car ownership environmental impact and/or mobility is a strong plus.

    • ğŸ‘‰ If your profile doesn't check all of the above yet, you can still apply, and weâ€™ll let you know if we think this position can be a good fit for you

    Why join us:

  • ğŸŒ Getaround Europe is a fast-growing startup located in the center of Paris, with global headquarters in San Francisco and an office in Oslo. We offer one of the most dynamic and diverse company cultures in town, and give every employee the opportunity to grow and the power to define their impact at Getaround.
  • ğŸŒ± The opportunity to have a positive impact on climate change. Cars are responsible for 17% of carbon emissions. In France, an independent study has shown that each connected car shared on Getaround replaces more than 5 self-owned cars.
  • ğŸ§  A place to learn and grow with weekly 1 on 1 meetings with your manager, frequent 360Â° feedback from your teammates, personal objectives to develop your potential, optional annual training, plus a team wiki that youâ€™ll contribute to improve
  • ğŸŒ An international team and company: our product is live in the US, France, Norway, Germany, Spain, Belgium and Austria.
  • ğŸ¡ A remote friendly policy: this position is based in our Paris office with up to 3 days of remote work per week.
  • ğŸ“ A monthly subsidy to cover part of your work-related expenses at home
  • ğŸ¤ Getaround is committed to equal opportunity. We value and embrace diversity, equity and inclusion of all our Getarounders
  • ğŸ—“ Unlimited 30% vouchers for your Getaround bookings
  • ğŸ’« Health insurance
  • ğŸ½ A Swile lunch card
  • ğŸ’» Apple equipment

    • Come join us!

DECATHLON DIGITAL is the power engine of DECATHLON transformation. With the expertise of over 4 000 teammates based in Lille, Paris, and Amsterdam, committed to creating the largest digital sports platform, leveraging tech innovation from design to value chain optimization, connected experiences, and product second life.

At DECATHLON DIGITAL, weâ€™re transforming global digital sports experiences to elevate how customers and employees sustainably play, train, and connect in more than 70 countries.

Every team has a daily meeting to align on priorities and solve issues â‡’ You wonâ€™t be left alone!

Every Monday we have a global weekly meeting where every team shares what they are working on and what they will do for the coming week â‡’ You will have visibility on the whole company!

Every quarter we have our OKR meeting (Objectives, Key Results) where each team shows the results of the previous quarter and the objectives of the following one â‡’ You will see the company grow and your own role inside of it!

During all these meetings everyone can challenge each other and all questions are more than welcome â‡’ Transparency is one of our key values, and we are always open to new ideas!
column61:
ğŸï¸Â Our process goes fast, we are reactive and we adapt to your availabilities. We can typically go through the whole process in 2-3 weeks:

  1. 20min video-call with a member of our Talent Acquisition team - To understand your background and motivations, and reply to your questions

  2. 1-hour face to face (or remote) interview with Oscar our CTO - To have a deeper discussion

  3. Half-a-day immersion at Stockly to meet all the team (on site) - Meet the team, put yourself in the shoes of a Stockler, ask all your questions

    If you pass this last step, you will receive a ğŸ‰Â Formal offer ğŸ‰

ğŸ¡Â Part of the process can be done remotely if you have constraints

We always respond to emails and give feedback throughout the process, whether it works out or not!
column68:
ğŸ”­Â Stockly is a tech-retail company solving the supply/demand mismatch in e-commerce.

  • With our technology, we connect in real-time e-commerce websites in need for stock with the inventory of hundreds of other retailers who have the same products available, and who can fulfill the order on their behalf.

  • E-retailers can sell products they donâ€™t own, while others can gain additional sales, in a seamless experience for the end-consumer.

ğŸ†Â Our mission is to create the worldâ€™s 1st globally shared inventory for retail. To better understand what we do, check outÂ our french pitch at BFMTV (ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·), orÂ our English pitch at Techstars (ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§).

ğŸš€Â Weâ€™ve already raised $20M+ with European top-tier investors among which Daphni, Eurazeo and Raise. Our proprietary technology, coded in-house from scratch, is already live across Europe with 450+ e-retailers, we grow x4 each year and wonâ€™t stop there.
column70: BackgroundYou come from a top engineering school, and have done a â€œClasse PrÃ©paâ€You spent 3-5 years in a top-tier tech start-up/scale-up or in a top large tech companyYou have a good understanding of tech topics, including how databases work and you already had a tech product role.Hard skillsYou are fluent in both French ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡· and English ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§You love mathematics and logicYou understand well databasesYou are experienced in translating ideas into precise guidelines for developersYou are very structured, organized and good at synthesizingSoft skillsSmart, curious and a fast learner: you donâ€™t know everything, but you can learn anythingTenacious: you never give up even when it is complex, you pay attention to details and have a hands-on approachAmbitious: you are ready toreshape the global e-commerce landscape with usNice, humble and friendly : you love learning from others and humbly sharing knowledge with them. You are able to interact with both tech and non-tech/business profilesAutonomous and hard working : you know how to manage your tasks independently and ask for help when neededIf you want to work with an ambitious team who wants to become #1 in the market in a fast paced environment, this is the place for you! ğŸš€

Company Description

Welcome to SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG!

Weâ€™re not just any network of online marketplacesâ€”weâ€™re the ultimate playground for digital pioneers! Join us and a European leader digital company thatâ€™s all about making life easier and more exciting with innovative products.

Why Join Us?

Weâ€™re on the lookout for top digital talent to help us meet the high expectations of our users and customers in Switzerland. In return, we offer a lively, friendly, and fast-paced work environment where you can unleash your full potential, achieve your goals, and celebrate your wins.

Job Description

The Role

The position is based in Sophia-Antipolis. Already living in the area or ready to pack your bags for the stunning French Riviera? Either way, we can't wait to have you on board!

Step into this exciting role and support our General Marketplaces team as our Head of Data Services.

As the Head of Data Services, youâ€™ll manage and grow an 80TB cloud-based data lake for Switzerlandâ€™s leading second-hand platforms (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo.ch). With your team, youâ€™ll dazzle our users and supercharge our efficiency by designing and integrating data and AI services into our products and internal tools.

Youâ€™ll be part of a cross-functional, agile data team with an open mindset and friendly teammates who love learning new skills and sharing theirs.

What Youâ€™ll Do

  • Lead and Inspire: Guide a team of Data & ML Engineers, analysts, and scientists.
  • Design and Develop: Make key decisions on data integration in the data lake and AI services for production environments.
  • Collaborate: Align with various teams on business and technical needs to drive your projects.
  • Ensure Excellence: Maintain a high-performance data foundation that scales with business needs and enhances our analytics capabilities.
  • Manage Projects: Oversee a full GCP project, including architecture, technology choices, cost monitoring, and alerting.

column68:
Join SMG SARL, a digital pioneer at the heart of innovation ğŸ’¡â€‹

Since its establishment in 1999, SMG SARL (formerly Ricardo) has emerged as a technological cornerstone within the Swiss Marketplace Group, headquartered in Zurich ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­â€‹. As a digital pioneer in the Swiss market, we are dedicated to meeting the needs of the most demanding users through our various digital platforms.

Our areas of expertise:

  • Real Estate Search ğŸ â€‹
  • Digital Automotive Platforms ğŸš˜â€‹
  • Marketplaces ğŸ•¸ï¸â€‹
  • Finance and Insurance ğŸ’°â€‹

An international and dynamic team:
With over 1000 employees spread across Switzerland ğŸ‡¨ğŸ‡­â€‹, Germany ğŸ‡©ğŸ‡ªâ€‹, Serbia ğŸ‡·ğŸ‡¸â€‹, India ğŸ‡®ğŸ‡³â€‹, and Vietnam ğŸ‡»ğŸ‡³â€‹, our Valbonne office ğŸ‡«ğŸ‡·â€‹ (French Riviera) hosts nearly 40 collaborators. Our teamsâ€™ strength resides in their diversity, featuring talents from various corners of the globe. This diversity enriches our corporate culture and fuels innovation.

Our values, the core of our success â€‹â€‹ğŸ’šâ€‹:

  • Better Together: We believe in the power of teamwork and collaboration with our various offices to drive innovation.
  • Aim High: We foster ambition and the pursuit of excellence in everything we do.
  • Act Responsibly: We are committed to acting with integrity and responsibility, both within our company and towards society.

At SMG SARL, you will have the opportunity to work on exciting projects, innovate, and make a significant difference in a dynamic and multicultural environment.
column70: About youWe already know youâ€™re talented, but here are some other requirements for the role:Â Fast learner and ability to connect the dots both from a business and technical perspectiveYou have extensive programming, SQL and data modelling skills in cloud environments (GCP, BigQuery is a plus)Â You have the ability to work well across different teams, feel comfortable with multithreading and deal with ambiguityYou do both project management and operational work, are able to delegate and spread knowledge and coachÂ You want to make a differenceâ€‚working in a dynamic, fast-paced environment for the leading second-hand marketplaces in Switzerland and work with cross located teams (You speak fluent English, French or German are a plus)Additional InformationRecruitment Process:For this job position, you need to be located in France and have a valid work permit.We believe in an efficient hiring process designed to respect your time:Talent Acquisition Screening Call: Get to know your experience and address any questions you may have.Hiring Manager Call: Discuss the role in detail and field any technical inquiries you may have.Technical caseÂ will be sent your way for a bit of homework. Weâ€™ll review it together during the team interview .Meet the Team:Â Following this, review together your tech challenge and enjoy a casual coffee chat with your potential team members.Â Final Decision and Offer: We'll extend an offer to you upon mutual agreement.Â Benefits youâ€™ll love:Training and conference budget available for everybody ğŸ§‘â€ğŸ«Strong engineering culture, empowerment and trustOpportunity to grow both professionally and personally in a stimulating environmentWork in an international team of talented engineersHome officeÂ 3 days/week maxYearly party with all our colleagues from the other countriesğŸ¥³Fresh fruits, Free coffee in the Office ğŸâ˜•Friday drinks & seasonal parties ğŸ»Macbook Pro or other upper class notebook and work equipment of your choice ğŸ’»Opportunity to travel regularly to our office in ZÃ¼rich and Zug ğŸš„ ğŸšƒA modern and cozy working place with a positive and friendly atmosphere12 recovery days in addition to the 25 holidays ğŸŒ´Lunch tickets ğŸ½ï¸Swimming pool and tennis court in free access right next to the office ğŸŠğŸ¾Â Please send yourÂ CV in EnglishÂ including a daytime number where we can reach out to you.Â This position is open to all candidates eligible to work inÂ France.Ready to work in Sophia-Antipolis, looking forward to meeting you!DisclaimerSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG primarily engages directly with candidates. We do not accept unsolicited resumes or candidate profiles from recruitment agencies unless we have specifically requested their assistance for particular roles. Any submissions made without a prior request from our Talent Acquisition team will not be acknowledged or considered. We appreciate the understanding and cooperation of recruitment agencies in respecting this policy.About UsSMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. is a pioneering network of online marketplaces and cutting-edge European digital company that simplifies peopleâ€™s lives with innovative products.SMG Swiss Marketplace Group AG. provides customers the best tools to meet their life decision needs. The portfolio includes Real Estate (ImmoScout24, Homegate, Immostreet.ch, home.ch, Publimmo, Acheter-Louer.ch, CASASOFT, IAZI, Flatfox), Automotive (AutoScout24, MotoScout24), General Marketplaces (anibis.ch, tutti.ch, Ricardo) and Finance & Insurance (FinanceScout24). The company was founded in November 2021 by TX Group AG, Ringier AG, La MobiliÃ¨re and General Atlantic.

column28:
CybelAngel was founded in 2013 in Paris and we count more than 150 employees worldwide (in the US, France, and Europe). We have a culture of team spirit, ambition and a high commitment to ethics.
We are constantly looking to add new talents and expertise in order to help us solve the growing security threats over the Web.

Our values: Be Curious; Be Bold and Be Stronger Together!

CybelAngelâ€™s mission is to create cutting-edge technologies to make the Internet a safer place. Thanks to our in-house developed solution we are able to detect data leaks over the Internet (e.g. Dark Web, Deep Web) as well as connected devices.

Using artificial intelligence, we identify sensitive data and provide a real-time alert service to our clients. We are therefore able to help major companies in securing and protecting their sensitive and confidential information and anticipating high risk security threats.
column38:
Our job everyday is to protect the data and critical assets of businesses world-wide by discovering hidden vulnerabilitiesâ€¦ before the bad guys do!

At CybelAngel, we see beyond perimeters to protect businesses from the most critical cybersecurity threats. Fortune 500 Global to mid-size companies world-wide, trust CybelAngelâ€™s global team of approximately 140 team members to protect their businesses from digital threats. With a combination of advanced machine learning, cyber analysis expertise, and a powerful suite of software solutions, CybelAngel detects and resolves our clients potential threats, long before they can fall into the hands of cyber criminals.

Our capabilities expand every day to uncover new risks, detect more threats, protect more clients, and create new possibilities for our employees.

With offices in Boston, Paris, and London, CybelAngelâ€™s global footprint allows for a thriving hybrid, office and remote-work environment. We are looking for exceptional â€˜go-gettersâ€™ who share our ambitious vision, innovative culture, high commitment to ethics, and enthusiasm for being the best possible place to work!

Our values:

  • Be Bold

  • Be Curious

  • Stronger Together
column57:
This is a new opening within the Engineering department, based in Paris 9 and offering a flexible remote work policy.

Your main mission will be to detect and explain potential anomalies in the operation of our advanced cybersecurity threat detection engine. Your results will be communicated toÂ  top management and influence the Product & Engineering roadmap.

You will explore gigantic amounts of data, including real-time data from the inner of our engine, historical and statistical data from our data warehouse, as well as detailed technical metrics and timelines of various events. Amongst this data, you will identify the main key metrics that are important to follow and set up adequate dashboarding and monitoring to detect potential anomalies. In the event of an anomaly, you will look for correlations with other events such as code and infrastructure changes, client-specific configuration updates, human interventions, external events, etc. and unravel the chain of causality. Your discoveries will be shared with top management and the Product & Engineering department.

To succeed in your mission, you will need to grow an in-depth understanding of our business, how our company operates, what our product does, how our technology works, etc. Your teammates will assist you in this learning process. Additionally, you will have access to senior engineers, product managers and cybersecurity analysts, who will share their expertise with you. This role will position you at a central position in the company.

For this position, we seek a senior data analyst, not only with strong analytical skills, but also an endless curiosity for topics ranging from technology to business and everything in between, as well as ability to bridge the gap between these areas and connect seemingly unrelated ideas.

Our stack

  • Google Looker Studio Pro (dashboard)

  • Google BigQuery (data warehouse)

  • Kibana / ElasticSearch (real-time data)

  • Datadog (technical metrics)

  • Python

Skello is a European company with one mission: to reinvent shifted work through a collaborative solution which enables the whole team to better anticipate, organize and communicate.

How do we do it? Through collaborative and intuitive technology. In concrete terms, Skello is a SaaS HR management solution for all establishments with complex schedules. For managers, Skello optimises the organisation of work and helps them make decisions about managing team costs. For employees, Skello facilitates their communication and simplifies their daily life.

Skelloâ€™s ambition is to be the number one solution for shifted work teams in Europe. To achieve this, Skello raised a â‚¬40M Series B round of financing from expert funds in the field (Partech, AglaÃ© Ventures & XAnge) in order to bring ever more value to our clients through new features and to open up new markets, beyond our historic industries such as hospitality, retail and health.

Contentsquare is a digital experience analytics company dedicated to better customer understanding and making the digital world more human. We power more human experiences through understanding, action, and trust.

Since our founding in France in 2012, we have grown to be a truly global team, representing more than 72 nationalities in offices around the world, including New York, Texas, Colorado, London, Paris, Rennes, Munich, San Francisco, Barcelona, Amsterdam, Tel Aviv, Tokyo, Singapore, and more.

In 2022, we raised $600M in Series F funding. In 2023, we were recognized as a certified Great Place to Work in 5 countries. In 2024, Heap and Hotjar joined the Contentsquare Group, strengthening our analytics platform to provide a 360 view of users' digital experience and to provide end-to-end service to the global market â€” from entrepreneurs and SMBs/growth companies to Enterprises.

Do you want to learn, innovate and contribute your unique perspective to an industry leader? Join the team dedicated to bringing more human analytics to the world!

Please Note: Scammers are posing as Contentsquare and Contentsquare team members. Weâ€™ll never initially contact you via text or GChat, and never solicit money from you. Please visit our careers blog for more information.

As a Senior Product Data Analyst, youâ€™ll leverage data to drive strategic decision-making and optimize product performance. Success in this position means delivering actionable insights that lead to measurable improvements in product KPIs and overall user satisfaction. This role is integral to our product team, ensuring data-driven decisions guide our product strategy and innovation efforts.Â 

Youâ€™ll join the Product Insights department, composed of the Product Data Analytics team and Product Research team. In charge of having a 360 customer knowledge view, we combine quantitative and qualitative insights to inform the product roadmap.Â Â You will be responsible to support an entire product line, and partner directly with the Director of Product of the Line youâ€™re covering, reporting to the manager of this team.

What youâ€™ll do:

  • Identify and establish the core Key Performance Indicators (KPIs) that the product team will focus on to measure product success and impact. Ensure these KPIs align with overall business objectives and provide a clear framework for evaluating product performance.
  • Guide and empower product teams with advanced methodologies and analytical tools to foster a data-driven culture. Provide training and support to ensure teams can independently leverage data insights in their decision-making processes.
  • Conduct thorough analysis of product performance metrics and user behavior to identify trends, issues, and opportunities for improvement. Use these insights to drive strategic decisions that enhance product functionality, user experience, and market competitiveness.
  • Partner with the Product researcher of your line to create and maintain an overview of the performance insights uncovered throughout the customer journey, identify the customer knowledge gaps that remain and leverage critical thinking to proactively influence the product roadmap discussions.Â Â 
  • Youâ€™ll partner directly with the Director of Product of the Line youâ€™re covering.

    • What youâ€™ll need to succeed:

  • Proficiency in statistical analysis, data modeling, and data visualization. Ability to interpret complex data sets and translate findings into actionable insights.Â 
  • Experience with data analysis, data modeling and visualization tools (SQL, DBT, Excel, Tableau, or similar software).Â  Expertise in creating advanced data visualizations that effectively communicate complex insights to a broad audience, including dashboards and interactive reports.
  • Capacity to identify issues, analyze root causes, and develop effective solutions. Ability to approach problems methodically and think critically. Meticulous in analyzing data and ensuring accuracy. Ability to validate findings thoroughly and maintain high standards in data integrity and reporting.
  • Ability to convey complex data insights clearly and effectively to non-technical stakeholders. Strong written and verbal communication skills for reporting and presentations.
  • Experience working in cross-functional teams, including product managers, engineers, and designers. Ability to build relationships and influence stakeholders at all levels of the organization.
  • Strong organizational skills and the ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously. Experience with project management tools and methodologies.
  • Understanding of business strategy and how data-driven insights can support and enhance product and business goals. Ability to align data analysis with business objectives.
  • Youâ€™ll need to have a prior experience as a data analyst and to hold a business or engineering degree

    • What makes you stand out:

  • You have a prior experience using Contentsquare platformÂ 
  • Understanding of machine learning concepts and experience with implementing predictive models to forecast product performance and user behavior.
  • Previous experience in product management or working closely with product managers to understand the full product lifecycle and strategic considerations.
  • Experience in the specific industry relevant to the companyâ€™s products, providing contextual understanding that can enhance the analysis and recommendations.

    • Why you should join Contentsquare:

    â–ªï¸ Weâ€™re humans first. We hire dedicated people and provide them with the trust, resources and flexibility to get the job done

    â–ªï¸ We invest in our people through career development, mentorship, social events, philanthropic activities, and competitive benefits

    â–ªï¸ We are a fast-growing company with a track record of success over the past 12 years, yet we operate with the agility of a startup. That means a huge chance to create an immediate and lasting impact

    â–ªï¸ Our clients, partners and investors love our industry-leading product

    To keep our employees happy and engaged, we are always assessing the benefits/perks we offer to ensure we are competitive. Here are a few we want to highlight:

    â–ªï¸ Virtual onboarding, Hackathon, and various opportunities to interact with your team and global colleagues both on and offsite each year

    â–ªï¸ Work flexibility: hybrid and remote work policies

    â–ªï¸ Generous paid time-off policy (every location is different)

    â–ªï¸Immediate eligibility for birthing and non-birthing parental leave

    â–ªï¸Wellbeing and Home Office allowances

    â–ªï¸A Culture Crew in every country to coordinate regular outings such as game nights, movie nights, and happy hours

    â–ªï¸ Every full-time employee receives stock options, allowing them to share in the companyâ€™s success

    â–ªï¸We offer many benefits in various countries -- ask your recruiter for more information

    We are a 2024Â Circle Back Initiative Employer â€“ we commit to responding to every applicant

    Contentsquare is an equal opportunity employer. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, race, color, religion, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, age, or any other characteristic protected by law.

    Your personal data is used by Contentsquare for recruitment purposes only. Read ourJob Candidate PrivacyNotice to find out more about data protection at Contentsquare and your rights. You can exercise your rights by using our dedicated Data Subject Rights Portal here.Â 

    Your personal data will be securely stored in our hosting providerâ€™s data center in Oregon (US west). We have implemented appropriate transfer mechanisms under applicable data protection laws.

With more than 300 professions involved in the business of Disneyland Paris, Data is becoming a key asset to manage and create value. Recently a Data Office has been created, with a mission of enabling DLP to create measurable value through the consolidation, sharing and use of analytical and operational data.Â 

Your environment ?

The Data Office mandates the development and governance of Reusable Data Products throughout the Technology and Digital organization, while allowing agility and flexibility in solution design.Â  In order to do this, it deploys governance and tools to ensure clear accountability for these data products and their quality.Â  The Data Office also demonstrates, coordinates and supports and innovates BI and AI through centres of excellence.Â 

While this journey is ongoing and already successful, a need for the right level of management for governance and solution has arisen, for which DLP needs to position a Data Solution and Governance Manager within the Data Office.As a Data Solution & Governance Manager, you will be responsible for the Solution & Governance Team, composed of five expertsÂ  :

  • Data Solution Engineer

  • Lead Data Quality

  • Lead Data Architecture

  • Data Governance CoordinatorÂ 

  • Lead Data Governance Technology

Your missions ?

  • Lead a team of experts, offering guidance, support, and mentorship.

  • Manage budgets and contracts related to tools and technical support for your team.

  • Ensure the development and implementation of data governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to uphold data quality, consistency, and security.

  • Support the design and development of large-scale data architectures that align with business objectives and are scalable.

  • Spearhead the evaluation and integration of emerging technologies and tools to enhance capabilities in data architecture and solution design.

  • Collaborate with stakeholders to establish best practices in data governance and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.

  • Collaborate closely with IT teams to integrate data governance principles into existing systems and processes.

  • Act as a subject matter expert on matters related to data governance and solutions, providing guidance and support to cross-functional teams.

  • Monitor and analyze key metrics and performance indicators related to data governance and solutions, and report on them accordingly.

What would make you successful in the role:

Preferably endowed with a master's level education in data architecture and/or data management, you should have a minimum of 5 years of experience in the field of data in all its facets.

  • You can collaborate with various stakeholders and conduct meetings in both French and English (C1 level).

  • You understand business needs and possess the ability to simplify complex information.

  • You are attentive to process compliance and committed to data quality.

  • You are curious, proactive, and passionate about data.

  • You are a meticulous, organized, pragmatic, and persevering individual.

  • You are recognized for your writing skills, particularly in synthesis.

  • You have an affinity for information management technologies, including SQL.

The Disneyland Paris difference

  • A comprehensive integration session and a wide range of skill-development training options

  • Great career opportunities (internal promotion or horizontal mobility)

  • An exceptional, international and multicultural environment concentrated on a unique site

  • The opportunity to join a unique company during a turning point including the extension of future Disney Adventure World, working to further improve our visitors' experience, including on the digital side...

Ready to be part of a great human adventure? Ornikarâ€™s team dedicates its mission to transform the overall car mobility experience for drivers around the world. They are developing innovative solutions that bring them closer everyday to becoming the key partner in car mobility : from learning how to drive, to ensuring your car, they create a positive and empowering experience for all drivers in France, in Spain, and shortly further beyond!

column28:
BlaBlaCar is the worldâ€™s leading community-based travel app enabling 26 million active members a year to share a ride in 21 countries. Its technology matches drivers with empty seats with passengers heading the same way, so they can share the cost of the trip. With the mission to be the go-to marketplace for shared travel, BlaBlaCar combines carpooling with bus journeys from over 4000 operators to offer a wide choice of affordable and sustainable travel solutions, all in one app.

In 2022, BlaBlaCarâ€™s trusted community connected 2 million meeting points worldwide and enabled 90 million human encounters. Carpool drivers saved 450 million euros, and all BlaBlaCarâ€™s mobility services contributed to avoiding 1.5 million tonnes of CO2 emissions.
column57:
About BlaBlaCar

BlaBlaCar is the worldâ€™s leading community-based travel app enabling 26 million members a year to carpool or travel by bus in 21 countries. Our team of 800 employees counts over 50 nationalities and is spread across our 5 global offices, 30% working fully remotely.

About BlaBlaCar DailyÂ 

We are an independent business unit growing fast following the acquisition of Klaxit in March 2023. The BlablaCar Daily team consists of 100 people together building the best commute carpooling solution. We are actively developing and testing the product in France, Belgium and Switzerland with thousands of active carpoolers every day.

Your Mission

Our Data services are organized following Data Mesh principles, distributing data ownership to domain-specific teams that manage, own, and serve the data as a product.Â

We deliver data products that address fraud-fighting, analytics to our hundreds of partners, and many more.Â 

As a Data Analyst, you directly influence user experience. At the intersection of different domains,Â  you have the opportunity to enrich your own knowledge and skills while collaborating with Product Managers, Designers, Software Engineers and customer-facing teams. You'll work closely with your Engineering Manager, 1 Data Engineer and 2 other Data Analysts.Â As well, you will belong to the Analytics Chapter, an internal community of 25+ analysts who meet regularly to share, learn and innovate on data analytics.

Your Responsibilities

As a Data Analyst working on the Data Daily scope, youâ€™ll be responsible for:

â€¢Infusing a data-informed mindset to our Business and Product strategy by working conjointly with Leadership to define, analyze and report on KPIsÂ 

â€¢Providing actionable insights on our userâ€™s behavior during Product discovery and delivery

â€¢Overseeing Product experimentation for several feature squads: designing AB test protocols, analyzing their impact, and communicating their results

Â â€¢Building, improving, and maintaining a suite of self-service Tableau dashboards and supporting data consumers in becoming autonomous in their usage of data

â€¢Working with our stack: dbt / SQL / Tableau / Airflow / BigQuery / GCP

â€¢Ensuring effective communication and support to stakeholders with varying levels of data proficiency

In your first 6 months on the team, you will contribute directly to various product improvements in our roadmap, and support our internal teams managing their partners in an ideal manner.Â 

Your Qualifications

â€¢At least 2 years of professional experience working as a Data Analyst, preferably in Product Analytics

â€¢Excellent command of SQL

â€¢Proficiency in data visualization tools

â€¢Passion for the Mobility industry

â€¢Strong analytical and problem-solving skills, ability to think strategically and communicating data clearly

â€¢You are organized, results-driven, and are able to prioritize in a changing environment

â€¢You enjoy sharing and learning from others

â€¢Fluent in English

If you donâ€™t meet 100% of the qualifications outlined above, tell us why youâ€™d still be a great fit for this role in your application!

What we have to offer:

â€¢ Full remote possible in the country of employment

â€¢ 4 additional weeks parental leave 100% paid

â€¢ Financial support for home office equipment

â€¢ 25 days holiday per year + RTT

â€¢ Local meal plan policies (Swile card in France)

â€¢ 50% transportation paid in France (Forfait MobilitÃ© Durable)

â€¢ Relocation package and visa support

â€¢ Free unlimited carpooling & bus rides

â€¢ Personal growth via trainings, mentorship, and internal mobility programs

â€¢ Employee Stock Ownership plan

â€¢ Regular team building events

â€¢ Mental health support through Moka.care

Interested in joining the ride?

Hereâ€™s what your hiring journey will look like:

â€¢ a 45-min video-call with ChloÃ©, Talent Acquisition Manager, to get to know you, understand your career expectations and answer your questions

â€¢ a 45 min video-call with Kineret Kimhi your future Manager to evaluate your communication and teamwork skills, followed by a 30 min live business case

â€¢ a home assignment to evaluate your technical skills, followed by a 60-min video-call with a future colleague and product manager

â€¢ a 30-min video-call with Emmanuel Martin-Chave, VP Data

Usually, our hiring process lasts 20-25 days and offers come within 48 hours.

Not sure yet?Â Check out our 100 reasons to join BlaBlaCar!

column68:
BlaBlaCar is the worldâ€™s leading community-based travel app enabling 26 million active members a year to share a ride in 21 countries. Its technology matches drivers with empty seats with passengers heading the same way, so they can share the cost of the trip. With the mission to be the go-to marketplace for shared travel, BlaBlaCar combines carpooling with bus journeys from over 4000 operators to offer a wide choice of affordable and sustainable travel solutions, all in one app.

In 2022, BlaBlaCarâ€™s trusted community connected 2 million meeting points worldwide and enabled 90 million human encounters. Carpool drivers saved 450 million euros, and all BlaBlaCarâ€™s mobility services contributed to avoiding 1.5 million tonnes of CO2 emissions.

A creator, artisan, and seller of high-quality objects since 1837, HermÃ¨s is an independent, family-owned French house.

Driven by a spirit of continuous entrepreneurship and high standards, HermÃ¨s cultivates its employeesâ€™ freedom and independence with responsible management.

The company perpetuates the passing-on of exceptional know-how through a strong regional presence that respects people and nature. Sixteen artisanal trades feed the creativity of the company, whose collections are presented in over 300 stores around the world.
