Job Description:

Airbus Helicopters is looking for a Data Quality management leader (f/m) to join our Data Governance central team based in Marignane, France.

Airbus Helicopters ambition is to make Vertical Lift the best choice to save lives, protect people, connect cities and reach any place.

The continuous improvement of the company goes through an efficient data management and the deployment of new digital capabilities, leading to reliability, competitiveness, sustainability and empowerment of its employees.

Today, organization is challenged by a scissor effect: an accelerated growth in technology and an urgent need to simplify a highly complex, fragmented and siloed data landscape.

The challenge of AH Data Governance organization is to drive the company to maximize data readiness for value creation in compliance with laws and regulations.

We are supporting business with methods, tools and animation of key data topics, such as the deployment of a data community, the set-up of the company data catalog, the acceleration of access to data, the guidance about data protection and compliance, etc.

In 2023, we have initiated a Company Data Quality Management framework, with the objective to put under control the key data of the company, securing the required level of quality.

With this open position, we will accelerate the deployment of this initiative and make Data Quality a key enabler to company performance.

You are looking for:

- Â  Â  Â  A challenge

- Â  Â  Â  A job with multiple and various interfaces

- Â  Â  Â  A wide view on Airbus Helicopters activities

- Â  Â  Â  A key role in company transformation

Your working environment:

Major economic hub with Marseille-Provence Airport, Marignane is a dynamic city in the southeast of France. It is located near the cities of Aix-en-Provence and Marseille, which host a rich cultural and tourist offer. Close to the beaches of the CÃ´te Bleue, it offers many options for water sports activities.

How we care for you:

  • Financial rewards: Attractive salary, agreements on success and profit sharing schemes, employee savings plan abounded by Airbus and employee stock purchase plan on a voluntary basis.

  • Work / Life Balance:Â  Extra days-off for special occasions, holiday transfer option, a Staff council offering many social, cultural and sport activities and other services.

  • Wellbeing / Health: Complementary health insurance coverage (disability, invalidity, death). Depending on the site: health services center, concierge services, gym, carpooling application.

  • Individual development: Great upskilling opportunities and development prospectsÂ  with unlimited access to +10.000 e-learning courses to develop your employability, certifications, expert career path, accelerated development programmes, national and international mobility.

At Airbus, we support you to work, connect and collaborate more easily and flexibly.Â  Â  Wherever possible, we foster flexible working arrangements to stimulate innovative thinking.

Your challenges:

Organization - Accountable for the process deployment

  • Finalize the set-up of Data Quality Management framework and ensure continuous improvement

  • Ensure methods integration within AH processes

  • Drive the development of required tools to support this new process

Connection - Ensure the efficient deployment and execution of Data Quality Management throughout business domains, animating and supporting key contributors to:

  • Identify Data Quality Topics considered as priorities

  • Understand non-quality root causes and propose remediation plans

  • Set-up continuous monitoring of selected Data Quality criteria

  • Follow-up the execution of remediation plans

Sponsorship â€“ Drive decisions and advise management

  • Report to AH top management about Data Quality status to ensure Data is managed as a company asset

Decisions taken will have a significant short-term impact on company performance and a long term influence on overall data management culture.

Your profile:

  • With a Master Degree and the conviction that Data is key to reach excellence, you are recognized for:

    • being autonomous, rigorous, a team player, results-oriented,

    • having adaptation and communication skills.

  • Expected competencies:

    • project management,

    • change management,

    • data management & analysis

  • French & English are mandatory.

This position requires a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Not a 100% match? No worries! Airbus supports your personal growth with customized development solutions.

Take your career to a new level and apply online now!

Stago is a French company in the In Vitro Diagnostics (IVD) industry with international activities. With operations in 18 countries, it has nearly 2,600 employees, half of whom are based out of France.
Stago is an independent, privately-owned company that brings together all skills and know-how in the field of biology and instrumentation to develop, manufacture and market the widest range of reagents and instruments for hemostasis analysis throughout the world.

Using the most advanced computer, electronic and biological technologies, Stago invests in research and innovation to develop ever more effective reagents, instruments and diagnostic solutions.
With more than 350 products on the market, Stago is a world leader in In Vitro Diagnostics and a preferred partner of medical laboratories.
Customer satisfaction is a strong value and everyone is aware that behind their actions there is a patient.

column38: Connecting Food is a Data management solution for agrifood supply chains for precise risk assessment, monitoring and compliance on quality and CSR criteria. We provide a food confidence platform to enable food & agriculture actors to gain precision, time and costs in the assessment and continual monitoring of their supplier and product base and share this information internally and externally.
column57:
Your mission within the company:

As part of the Customer Success team, your mission is to ensure the successful implementation of our solutions at our clients. You will actively participate in the strategic discussions regarding the development and enhancement of our product offerings and solution modules. Your role is crucial in helping our clients achieve their goals and in contributing to the continuous improvement of our services.

Your daily responsibilities:

Initially, you will be integrated into a major project for one of our clients, where you will implement a new module of our solution. You will be responsible for:

  • Defining and documenting the process

  • Configuring part of the solution

  • Communicating and coordinating with technical teams regarding developments

  • Handling a large amount of data

  • Developing relevant dashboards using a BI tool

These operational tasks will be complemented by a strategic dimension:

  • Automating the operational tasks you have carried out within this specific project

  • Contributing to the structuring of our offerings

  • Collaborating with our product team to identify areas for improvement in our module

Subsequently, you will be integrated into other projects and may work across all modules of our solution. Your responsibilities will include:

  • Participating in new implementation projects: studying feasibility, configuring the platform, testing data, etc.

  • Providing support to our clients using the solution: responding to their requests, investigating and resolving issues, and conducting training sessions

  • Product exploration: translating needs into specifications

  • Testing new technical deliveries

What we offer:

  • Meaningful work: at Connecting Food, our mission is to bring more transparency to the agri-food supply chains

  • A learning environment within a diverse team (Solution experts, Customer success managers, product owners, developers, salespeople, etc.)

  • An innovative digital solution (blockchain, web apps, Digital Twin, etc.)

  • A key role in daily interactions with our clients (major players in the agri-food industry)

The HR Data Analyst will play a pivotal role in collecting, analyzing, and interpreting HR data to drive strategic decision-making and support HR initiatives. Use data analysis to improve HR practices, enhance employee experiences, and contribute to the organization's overall success.

Cross functional role :
YES

External relations :
External providers

MAIN MISSIONS, OBJECTIVES AND KPIS RELATE

Data Governance :
Â· Gather, organize, and maintain HR data from various sources to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Â· Establish robust data management practices and procedures.
Â· Ensure HR data handling complies with data protection regulations.
Â· Safeguard the confidentiality and security of sensitive HR data.
Â· Ensure Bridge with data department.

Data Analytics :
Â· Analyze HR data to extract valuable insights and trends.
Â· Generate regular and ad-hoc reports, visualizations, and dashboards to aid decision-making.
Â· Develop and monitor key HR metrics and KPIs to assess the effectiveness of HR processes.
Â· Contribute to the development of data-driven strategies to improve HR outcomes.
Â· Provide actionable insights derived from data analysis to support HR initiatives.
Â· Collaborate with HR teams to make data-informed decisions that enhance HR

Process Improvement:
Â· Identify opportunities to streamline HR data processes and enhance data quality.
Â· Collaborate with HR teams to implement process improvements, automation and increase efficiency.
Â· Provide training and support to HR staff on data-related tools and best practices.
Â· Share knowledge and insights with colleagues to promote a data-driven HR culture.

column28:
Chez ECOSYS, nous pensons que la data favorise lâ€™intelligence collective et que lâ€™intelligence collective est la meilleure solution pour construire un monde durable. At Lifen, we believe that everyone deserves high-quality, accessible, and financially sustainable healthcare. Our digital solutions are the missing piece for a truly patient-centric care system.

We build bridges between stakeholders by facilitating the information flow: providers, insurance companies, governments, patients and the most innovative digital health apps. How? We solve the interoperability puzzle, so digital health innovators and healthcare facilities donâ€™t have to. Our FHIR platform helps cloud-based apps integrate seamlessly with primary data systems, sans the hassle of connector jigsaws.

Lifen is also a pioneer in Artificial Intelligence: we build algorithms that reliably and automatically structure and integrate health information for a truly complete and dependable record system, eliminating hundreds of thousands worth of hours of routine administrative tasks.

Born in Paris and growing all over Europe, we are more than 180 Lifeners committed to advancing the digital revolution in the healthcare sector.

column57:
Our Mission

At Prose, we donâ€™t believe in â€œone-size-fits-most.â€ We create custom beauty care (hair & skin at the moment) that is inclusive to all profiles, needs, and preferences. Each of our products is customized to a personâ€™s needs based on the results from an online consultation. The individual data is processed through a proprietary algorithm and made-to-order in the Prose lab using natural active ingredients. Marrying emerging technologies with the best in beauty, Prose is truly creating something special.

This is the opportunity to join a fast-growing scale-up and an energetic team that works together to deliver creative solutions that are transforming the way people think about and shop for hair and skin care. Weâ€™re looking for talented problem solvers who lead with passion and who face any task with a positive mindset. We are serving millions of customers right now in North America!

Position Summary

As a Data Analyst Junior, you are in charge of running various analyses in order to deliver insights and data-driven solutions to our stakeholders.

Key Responsibilities

  • Develop and deliver data based insights and solutions for our various stakeholders (chemists, marketing team, â€¦)
  • Contribute to end to end execution of experiments (A/B tests) that includes setup, QA , analysis and communication of results
  • Develop and maintain dashboards for RD and Innovation
  • Recommend different ways to constantly improve data reliability and quality
  • Stay current on new technologies and continuously improve skills
  • Bring your personal knowledge and ideas to help solve problems creatively and effectively
  • Promote the company's mission and values

Key Candidate Requirements

  • Master degree in engineering/statistics/business Analytics
  • Familiar with R with a good knowledge of data.table, Rmarkdown, ggplot2, plotly or equivalent
  • Fundamentals of statistics used in A/B testing
  • First experience in dataviz (Google Data Studio, Tibco Spotfire, etc.)
  • A knack for writing clean, readable and maintainable code
  • Familiar with Git, a Unix shell, an editor (or IDE) and all others day-to-day developer tools
  • Familiar with Python and SQL would be a plus
  • Demonstrates strong collaboration skills and ability to work cross functionally
  • Demonstrates ability to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders, in French and English

Perks & Benefits

  • Competitive compensation package (base salary, target bonus and equity)
  • Health insurance (Benefiz) 100% covered by Prose + tickets restaurants
  • Nice and trendy office located between Opera and Grands Boulevards (Paris, 2eme)
  • Wellness membership (ClassPass)
  • On-going training and development programs
  • An abundance of office snacks

Prose values

Intentional Inclusivity

  • We know the best ideas come from open minds and willingness to listen. While our products cater to the individual, an invitation into our process is always open to our community.
  • We value our differences and diverse backgrounds by communicating openly, managing with transparency and striving to understand one anotherâ€™s perspective. Itâ€™s a key ingredient to our innovation.

Connected Collaboration

  • Our strength as a group will outlast our efforts as individual contributors. With offices across countries (and across boroughs) staying inventive and agile deepens our clear vision and consistent communication.
  • We stay in a spirit of entrepreneurial collaboration: We do not have consensus at all times, but we trust one another to work toward our common goals. Our success is an expression and result of our progressive and gratifying teamwork.

Driven, Together

  • We value ownership and coaching that encourages employees to think constructively and creatively about the business. We view employees as leaders and individuals who are accountable, resourceful and responsible. Anyone and everyone is encouraged to lead.
  • We recognize that in order to continue thinking one step ahead, we will need to try new things. We strive to provide an open environment that accepts this truth making space for new ideas to emerge.

Humanity Always

  • We assume good intentions in every interaction keeping ourselves accountable for the climate we create. We seek to understand our co-workers through this lens of conscious bienveillance, authenticity and fellowship.
  • We operate with the intention of preserving resources, creating an environment we can all live in â€” for our business and the world. Sustainable care is essential to our ethos as an organization. We take a mindful approach to how we think about our people (employees) and our planet.

column36: European Master Data Regional Functional Expert F/M/X
column57:
Job Description:

Segment: Royal Canin

Location: Aimargues

Contract: Permanent

The European Master Data Regional Functional Expert is a key enabler for delivering the Royal Canin strategy. It impacts the way we market, sell and distribute our products and enables the execution and strengthening of our current business model. Consequently, Royal Canin has defined Data Management as a strategic transformation area to support our growth.

The European Master Data Regional Functional Expert (RFE) is member of the European Supply Chain Planning Team and a key function in the new MDM Organization.

  • Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, Business Administration or related field with at least 5 years business related experience is preferred
  • Proven experience In data management, preferably In a data management role
  • Fluent English, French as plus
  • Advanced skills in MS Office applications, particularly MS Excel, Information System qualification a plus
  • Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a strong attention to detail
  • Ability to work independently, prioritize tasks and meet deadlines in a fast-paced environment
  • Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with the ability to collaborate effectively across diverse teams
  • Strong understanding of data management principles, data governance and data quality best practices
  • Proficiency in using data management tools and systems, such as ERP systems, data flow, data modelling, data propagation
  • Proficiency in database management systems (e.g., SQL, Oracle, SAP) and data integration tools Is a plus
  • Good knowledge of Supply Chain & APS Is a plus

1. Data Management

  • Deploy and enforce global data governance standards and procedures across Europe to ensure data integrity, consistency and compliance with regulatory requirements with the support of Global teams and Local MD Key users
  • Establish, enforce & coordinate the execution of workflow procedures to ensure timely population of master data elements
  • Be Accountable for the Regional product data quality (completeness, accuracy, on time, â€¦)
  • Define and Implement Key Performance Indicators measuring the Regional data quality and adherence to MDM processes
  • Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing regular audits and validation checks to identify and resolve data discrepancies
  • Identify and resolve data quality issues in a timely manner to minimize impact on business operations
  • Oversee the creation, maintenance and accuracy of master data records in the organizationâ€™s database and systems
  • Back up the European Master Data Admin in creating, updating and maintaining master data records in accordance with established procedures and standards

2. Community of Practice

  • Create and animate the EU MDM Community of Practice (20-30 Key Users across Europe)
  • Provide guidance and support to key users on proper data entry best practices, data standards and system functionality
  • Develop and deliver training materials and documentation to educate key users on data management processes and procedures
  • Foster a culture of data stewardship and accountability across the organization
  • Train local MD Key users

3. System Maintenance and Support

  • Be, as RFE, key contact to collaborate with DT teams to configure and maintain master data management systems and tools within an agreed Service Level Agreement
  • Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to users experiencing data-related issues

4. Process Optimization & Continuous Improvement

  • Maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, standards and procedures
  • Streamline data management processes and workflows to improve efficiency and effectiveness
  • Engage with the Global Item MDM Team in CIP/new tool implementation (analyse, design, develop, test, deploy)
  • Collaborate with stakeholders to define and implement system enhancements and process improvements

5. Data Analysis

  • Assist in data analysis and reporting activities to support business decision-making and strategic initiatives
  • You will work in a multicultural environment (more than 40 nationalities) and where your dog will be welcomed by more than 100 other Associatesâ€™ dogs at the office!Â Â Â 
  • You will work in a unique campus, which gathers more than 800 Associates working for: the international HQ, the French subsidiary, two laboratories, a kennel and a cattery with more than 200 cats & dogs, and finally the most important factory of the Royal Canin groupÂ Â Â 
  • A unique and ideal work environment to become the leader in health through nutrition for cats and dogs!Â Â 
  • You will evolve in the heart of an innovative production plant that will challenge you, on a daily basisÂ Â 

Royal Canin's CSR commitments, to build a better world for tomorrow:Â Â 

  • Since 2015, no waste to landfill is made by the 16 Royal Canin factories in the worldÂ 
  • All Royal Canin products manufactured in Europe are ISO 14001 certified from design to factory gateÂ 
  • Since 2017, Royal Canin has supported the K-DOG program of the Curie Institute, which trains dogs to detect breast cancer via olfaction.Â 

Mars is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process because of a disability, it is available upon request. The company is pleased to provide such assistance, and no applicant will be penalized as a result of such a request.

column28:
Founded in 2016, OCUS produces high-quality, custom visual content at scale for international brands. To do so, they rely on a global community of over 20,000 highly-qualified photographers and image creators. Product-driven, they use state of the art tech to make the whole process seamless both for brands and image creators.

Today, they deliver 4000 photoshootings each week in 120+ countries, for customers such as UberEats, Grubhub, Radisson, Booking.com.
By investing constantly in R&D and new technologies, they make intelligent content that reaches the right audience at the right time. They have closed a 20Mâ‚¬/$24M investment in March 2021 to further invest in product development and engineering while expanding its market presence worldwide.

Four years ago, they were three people sitting at one desk. Today, the team is made of 100 passionate people from 20 nationalities, working from Paris, New York, Singapore.
column57:
About OCUS

In the digital age, images are a crucial driving force for large companies, along with effective search and seamless payment. But scaling operations for high coverage, quality, and customer experience can be an expensive and time-consuming challenge.

Thatâ€™s where OCUS comes in. As an AI company, we provide all-in-one solutions that handle professional photography creation, automated quality control and post-production.

Our clientsâ€™ resounding successes inspire us to aim even higherâ€¦Experiencing an increase of over 25% in conversion rates, up to 88% saved images with our QA and editing AI tool, and up to 30% product coverage across apps and websites.

So why wait? Join us today and be a driving force behind the future of imagery!
column61:
Our hiring process

Hereâ€™s a glimpse into our hiring process, which is designed to help us find the best talent while being fair and accessible:

  • First, a screening call with our hiring manager

  • Then a business case that will take no more than three hours to complete. Once youâ€™ve submitted your work, weâ€™ll provide you with feedback during a team review

  • If we like what we hear, time for the reference check

  • Lastly, youâ€™ll be invited to a culture-fit interview and meet our nerdy AND sweet CEO before extending a (great) offer ;)

Weâ€™re committed to providing equal opportunities to all candidates. If you have a medical condition or specific needs that require adjustments to our process, please let us know. We want to ensure that you have every chance to succeed, and weâ€™ll work with you to make any necessary adjustments.

column28:
At Joko, they leverage technology to help their users shop smarter: they help people preserve their purchasing power, buy more responsibly, and save time â€” all at once. Their ambition is to have a positive impact on the everyday life of hundreds of millions of consumers around the world. To achieve that, they have built an app as well as a smart browser that provides users with:

  • online and in-store cashback
  • automatically applied coupon codes
  • interest-free â€˜buy now pay laterâ€™ on any shopping website
  • information on their purchasesâ€™ carbon emissions
  • and much more!

Joko was created in 2018 by Xavier, Alexandre, and Nicolas and the team has reached great milestones already:

  • 3m+ users
  • 3000+ merchant partners
  • â‚¬12m+ raised from leading European investors

column57:
This position is remote-friendly.

ğŸ§šğŸ»Â Our Data team

The Data team at Joko is turning mountains of data into actionable insights for all the teams! The Data team is part of our Operations department led by Quentin, our COO, and our mission is to empower the company to make informed decisions.

More specifically, the teamâ€™s responsibilities are:

  • Data for Business: We create top-notch reports and tools, making it easy for teams to dive into data and excel in their decision-making.

  • Help our stakeholders with the best data stack: We load and transform data, automate reports, and continuously improve our data stack. This allows teams to use valuable insights built on robust and scalable foundations.

  • Spread the data culture: At Joko, we have a strong engineering and tech culture across all teams, making it an ideal environment for our Data team to have a significant impact. We provide support and training on data tools to our stakeholders, and by closely collaborating with them, we ensure that our solutions align perfectly with their operational needs.

ğŸ¯ What You Will Do

As a Data Analyst, you will have a cross-functional role and collaborate closely with teams to understand our data and develop insights.

  • Deep-dive analyses: You will explore and analyse data to uncover trends, patterns, and potential issues that will help in the decision-making processes across all teams.

  • Reporting and Data Visualization: You will participate in creating content, such as dashboards and charts, using our data visualization tool. You will be involved in defining the reportâ€™s content and constructing dashboards and charts to effectively communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders.

  • Data loading and transformation: You will be involved in loading and transforming the data as we have a â€œfull stackâ€ approach in Data at Joko. Of course, you will get some help on Data Engineering parts but you will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our data.

  • Interactions with stakeholders: You will work hand-in-hand with them to understand their needs, collect their feedback, and also evangelize data usage to help them make smarter choices.

  • Continuous Learning and Improvement: As â€œnever stop learningâ€ is one of our values, you will grow along the way and learn how to use analytical methods and the different tools that we use (and will use) in our data stack.

The Data team at Joko is turning mountains of data into actionable insights for all the teams! The Data team is part of our Operations department led by Quentin, our COO, and our mission is to empower the company to make informed decisions.

More specifically, the teamâ€™s responsibilities are:

  • Data for Business: We create top-notch reports and tools, making it easy for teams to dive into data and excel in their decision-making.

  • Help our stakeholders with the best data stack: We load and transform data, automate reports, and continuously improve our data stack. This allows teams to use valuable insights built on robust and scalable foundations.

  • Spread the data culture: At Joko, we have a strong engineering and tech culture across all teams, making it an ideal environment for our Data team to have a significant impact. We provide support and training on data tools to our stakeholders, and by closely collaborating with them, we ensure that our solutions align perfectly with their operational needs.

ğŸ¯ What You Will Do

You will be the key partner of the Product team when it comes to analyzing our products. You will dig into our data to help improve products, create better user experiences, and guide smart decisions.

  • Foundations of Product Analytics: You will build the foundations of how we perform Product Analytics at Joko by ensuring that the Product team has the right tools and reports to make informed decisions.

  • Deep-dive analyses: You will explore and analyze data to uncover trends, patterns, and potential issues that will help in the decision-making and prioritization processes of the Product team.

  • Performance monitoring and AB testing: You will build and monitor key indicators adapted to product use cases. Through AB testing, you will enable the continuous assessment of our featuresâ€™ success and identify opportunities for improvement.

  • Reporting and Data Visualization: You will participate in creating content, such as dashboards and charts, using our data visualization tool. You will be involved in defining the reportâ€™s content and constructing it to effectively communicate data-driven findings to stakeholders.

  • Data loading and transformation: You will be involved in loading and transforming the data as we have a â€œfull stackâ€ approach in Data at Joko. Of course, you will get some help on Data Engineering parts, but you will be involved in the entire lifecycle of our data.

  • Cross-team Collaboration: You will collaborate with Product Managers, engineers, and other stakeholders to understand their needs, collect their feedback, and also evangelize data usage to help them make smarter choices.

DECATHLON DIGITAL is the power engine of DECATHLON transformation. column28:
As a creator of customized financial solutions, Natixis helps its clients realize their projects
everywhere in the world. It puts its asset & wealth management, financing, insurance and
financial services expertise to work so that they can make their ambitions become reality.

A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, the second-largest banking group in France, Natixisâ€™ clients
include corporations, financial institutions, investors, customers of Groupe BPCEâ€™s networks
(Banque Populaire and Caisse dâ€™Epargne) and the public sector.

Natixis fosters an entrepreneurial spirit throughout all its business lines to furnish
increasingly innovative services and solutions to its clients. To measure up to its clientsâ€™
ambitions, Natixis is agile, ingenious and responsible.

Today Natixis is poised to go further in the areas of expertise that it has chosen to develop,
in digitalizing the products and services that it delivers to clients and differentiating itself by
leveraging its skills.

Natixis continues to globally expand its presence and expertise. Its presence in 38 countries
provides opportunities for its clients.

At Sanofi, we pursue the miracles of science to improve peopleâ€™s lives. In France, more than 20,000 passionate men and women tirelessly push their limits to transform the practice of medicine and improve patient health with drugs and vaccines.

The desire to advance science is our strength. We want to improve the health of populations and find new solutions for patients by combining scientific progress and advanced technologies.

In France, we provide more than 400 drugs, vaccines and health products, including 18 vaccines and more than 200 drugs of major therapeutic interest.

Sanofiâ€™s roots are anchored in France where most of the Research and Development is located. In the French medical research landscape, we hold a central role and actively participate in the construction of a dynamic health sector.

To contribute to the world of tomorrow, three commitments guide our actions: access to care for the most vulnerable, inclusion of all through work and preservation of the planet. Nothing would be possible without the remarkable mobilization of our employees and partners.

Le contenu du poste est libellÃ© en anglais car il nÃ©cessite de nombreuses interactions avec nos filiales Ã  lâ€™international, l'anglais Ã©tant la langue de travail.

Accelerator â€“ Digital Data Analyst â€“ All Gender

Location: Paris

Remote working : 2 days remote working, 3 days on site

About the job

At Sanofi, weâ€™re committed to providing the next-gen healthcare that patients and customers need. Itâ€™s about harnessing data insights and leveraging AI responsibly to search deeper and solve sooner than ever before. Join our Accelerator R&D as Digital Data Analyst and you can help make it happen. Your job? As a Data Analyst, you will have a direct impact on the business by deriving insights from Data and ensuring the quality, usability, and security of Sanofiâ€™s data.

Sanofi currently has great opportunities to join our R&D Accelerator. You will have a chance to help build our Digital R&D products by developing outstanding capabilities that will participate in new drug discovery together with scientists, in trial efficiency and cycle time reduction, leveraging Data Analytics and Artificial Intelligence. This is a great role for someone who is analytical, creative, curious, with strong attention to detail. In return we offer you the opportunity of working in an innovative environment helping Sanofi build better solution.

Main responsibilities:

  • Perform data analysis and provide input to solution design and architecture to ensure the solution meets requirements.
  • Performs exploratory data analysis and feature generation
  • Drive alignment across stakeholders on enterprise data models and definitions
  • Partner with stakeholders to get buy-in on, develop, and implement Sanofiâ€™s data management standards, policies, and best practices
  • Gather requirements needed to sustainably implement data management standards

About you

Experience:

  • Demonstrate strong understanding of databases and data structures, and
  • Previous experience working with tools used to support data management, specifically business glossary and metadata management, data cataloging, and data quality
  • Experience developing best Lean & Agile practices, policies, and/or procedures
  • Have worked in an environment with stringent privacy laws and regulations
  • Experience in a healthcare company while not essential would be a strong plus

Soft skills:

  • Experience working with multiple teams to drive alignment and results
  • Self-motivated, takes initiative
  • Problem solving & critical thinking

Technical Skills

  • Strong experience in SQL writing and profiling of Data & Python
  • Good knowledge of cloud computing and data storages. Knowing AWS is a plus
  • One or multiple of the following visualization skills: Tableau, PowerBI, seaborn, matplolib, plotly, ggplot, bokeh
  • Project management & support: JIRA projects & service desk, Confluence, Teams
  • Knowledge of Informatica Suite of Tools

Education:

  • Masterâ€™s Degree in Data Analytics, Mathematics, Economics, Computer Science, Information Management or Statistics

Languages: English

Why choose us?

We provide a highly collaborative environment, with an opportunity to work with a world class team. You will be able to:Â 

  • Engage in meaningful work that combines the challenges of the medical, pharma, and technical fields, offering abundant opportunities for professional growth and impact
  • Contribute to a company that is not only a leader in healthcare but also a pioneer in digital transformation, shaping the future of global health.Â 
  • Be part of an organization that values diversity, inclusion, and the richness of different backgrounds and experiences.Â 

Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary.

Progress doesnâ€™t happen without people â€“ people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Letâ€™s pursue progress. And letâ€™s discover extraordinary together.

At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity.Â 

Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com!

column28:
Le Wagon is the leading education company specialised in tech bootcamps. We teach people the skills they need to change their lives, kick-start their tech career or launch their own startups. We offer courses in software development, data science, UX design or product management in 45 campuses worldwide and online. Founded in Paris in 2013 by Boris Paillard, Romain Paillard and SÃ©bastien Saunier, Le Wagon has graduated more than 15,000 students from all walks of life, including many entrepreneurs who created 200 startups and raised $800M globally.

With a recognised pedagogy, Le Wagon is the worldâ€™s most acclaimed bootcamp with more than 2,000 five star reviews on Switchup and Coursereport, and has been partnering with some of the most respected global companies, including IKEA, Total, LVMH, HEC Paris or SociÃ©tÃ© GÃ©nÃ©rale, transforming their workforce worldwide.

In March 2020, we raised our first â‚¬17m in a series A funding round to accelerate our growth building a global education platform for tech upskilling and developing our corporate activity. The team is 170 Wagoners and growing, located in 45 campuses in EMEA, LATAM, Canada, Asia and Africa!
column57:
Le Wagon is a global leader in immersive tech training. Our mission is to train people from all backgrounds in coding, data and product skills, give them the best learning experience of their life, and help them accelerate in their career. We also help companies become more data-driven by leveraging their data and unlocking their employeesâ€™ potential through corporate training.

Founded in Paris in 2013, Le Wagon now has campuses in +40 cities across 25 countries, including global tech hubs such as Berlin, London, Tokyo, Shanghai, Singapore, and SÃ£o Paulo. Most importantly, Le Wagon is a community of 26,000+ graduates from all walks of life, including career changers, digital nomads and many entrepreneurs - whoâ€™ve created 220+ tech startups and raised $1B+ and counting!

About the role

We are seeking a Data Product Manager with a passion for creating and continuously improving technical training content. This role involves overseeing the development of training modules in Data Analytics and Data Science, managing updates to our existing courses, and ensuring the technical excellence of our offerings.

With such a wide variety of content types, we are looking for a data product manager to manage several content development projects, create and write new technical content on data analytics and data science, propose ideas of content development and improvement roadmap, improve and maintain our technical products and setups (Wott, etc), manages product data analysis projects to define what works, student feedback, satisfaction with content, etc.

Your Mission

Technical Content Oversight

  • Take full ownership of data training products, serving as the primary point of contact for all content updates across various departments (B2B, B2C, B2U).

  • Act as the content gatekeeper, setting and overseeing the global development roadmap and budget for training products.

  • Conduct ongoing technology and industry research to stay ahead of trends in data analytics and data science.

  • Coordinate and define the roles and missions of freelancers engaged in our bootcamps.

  • Lead content creation and updates, manage the backlog of content suggestions, and participate in pedagogical committees to prioritize updates.

Training Course Production Management

  • Handle incoming briefs from the Product team, effectively estimating project needs, target audiences, budgets, and technical requirements.

  • Develop and implement detailed roadmaps for new training initiatives, including planning kickoff meetings and setting critical milestones and deadlines.

  • Provide regular updates to stakeholders on production status, challenges, and technical issues, ensuring all materials meet the highest standards of quality.

Freelancer Collaboration

  • Ensure freelancers have access to necessary resources, including content, templates, and technical support, while facilitating content validation by technical leads.

  • Manage contractual and legal relationships with freelancers, including NDAs, project deadlines, and budget allocations.

Data Process and Technical Product Management

  • Oversee data analysis projects to gauge content effectiveness, gather student feedback, and measure overall satisfaction.

  • Maintain and enhance our technical platforms and data tools (Wott, etc), collaborating with the engineering & data team to advocate for and implement feature improvements.

Create Data Models & answer business needs

  • Collect, clean, and analyze large and complex data sets from multiple sources

  • Write complex SQL queries and create DBT models

  • Produce and maintain data models documentation

  • Identify and track key performance indicators (KPIs) to measure the success of data-driven initiatives

  • Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to provide real-time insights to key stakeholders

column57:
At AXA IM our purpose, to act for human progress by investing for what matters, is central to every action we take as a business. As a responsible asset manager, we actively invest for the long-term to help our clients, our people and the world to prosper.

Â 

As a future Senior Market Data Analyst, you will report to our Head of Market Data services and you will be part of the Data & Analytics Management team.

Â 

DISCOVER your opportunity

Â 

Within the Data & Analytics Management department, the Market Data team has a transversal role, in charge of the Procure to Pay process for AXA IM globally (offices located in Europe, Asia, US): this covers analysis of the needs, identification of providers, costs negotiation, contracts set-up (inc. legal review), invoices management, finance controlling and reporting.

The Market Data team is operating in an international and multi-cultural context in relation with various people among others AXA IM users, Providers, Finance teams, AXA Insurance entities, .â€¦

Â 

AXA IM is looking for a Senior Market Data Analyst (alternatively a Senior Market Data Finance Specialist) to reinforce its team in a challenging environment.

The candidate (profile Market Data Analyst) will primarily be in charge of:

  • Analyze the needs, propose solutions/alternatives
  • Negotiate with Market Data providers (new contracts, renewals, divestments, â€¦) incl. costs and legal terms
  • Perform analysis (optimization plans/mergers & acquisitions, â€¦.)
  • Communicate internally on rights & obligations to make sure services are used in a compliant manner
  • Participate to the Budget creation and follow-up

A Market Data Finance Specialist profile will be more focused on:

  • Management of the INFOmatch database
  • Analysis of the Actuals compared to Budget / INFOmatch figures
  • Supervision of the invoice monitoring, inc. accruals and reversed accruals processes
  • Budget creation and follow-up
  • Reporting

Aircall is on a mission to revolutionize the business phone industry!

We exist to empower every professional to have richer conversations. We provide an entirely cloud-based voice solution, which seamlessly integrates with popular productivity and helpdesk tools. We have raised more than $220 million since 2015, and our base of 8000+ customers (and growing) is at our forefront.

Behind our product are the amazing teams driving it, split between Paris, New York, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin and remote locations. Despite our distance, we all work together to drive our product!
column36: Principal Growth Data Analyst - Bay Area -
column57:
Aircall is a place where voices are valued.

Backed by over $220 million of investment since 2015, we create technology that fuels accessible, transparent and collaborative communication to empower our base of 18,000+ customers (and growing) to make authentic, human connections.

Conversation is a cornerstone of our culture. Wherever our people find themselves in the Aircall world â€“ Paris, New York, San Francisco, Sydney, Madrid, London, Berlin, or at home â€“ everyone has a voice that is valued.

Whatever your background, wherever youâ€™re from â€“ we want you to join the conversation. Letâ€™s talk.

About the team

Our data team is the backbone of Aircallâ€™s decision-making process, driving product development and business growth with cutting-edge data products, tools, and actionable insights

About the role

As a senior to Principal Growth Data Analyst, you'll provide invaluable insights to our growth organization in the Bay Area, acting as the data lead for the Growth team and working closely with our CTO, CPO, and other C-level executives. You'll support impactful initiatives, including pricing, packaging, multi-product strategies, and self-service approaches.

On top of the growth team, youâ€™ll collaborate cross-functionally with Sales, Finance, Marketing, and Customer Relations to translate data needs into powerful solutions. You'll also establish best practices in analytics and mentor team members, ensuring high standards in data governance and insight generation.

This position can be based in the Bay Area (preferred) or in our NYC HQ.

Your mission @ Aircall:

  • Partner with marketing, growth, and business leaders to define the growth strategy and deliver key projects in customer acquisition, engagement, and retention
  • Provide actionable insights and compelling narratives to influence major decisions at the C-level
  • Build a culture of experimentation by designing and executing rigorous AB tests to measure business impactÂ 
  • Enhance team processes and leverage self-service analytics to better serve business leaders
  • Work with data engineers and become their relay to continuously improve the data stack, governance practices, and analysis quality
  • Develop the data-driven culture at Aircall

    • A little more about you:

  • 6+ years of analytical experience in a tech savvy environment with high standard outcome
  • Proficiency in SQL and Python for deriving insights
  • Data-driven, structured and solution oriented with extensive experience in building rigorous experiments
  • Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to explain complex data clearly to stakeholders at all levels
  • You have an insatiable curiosity and are biased toward action
  • Previous experience contributing to growth initiatives is a plus

    • Key traits we look for:

    You are coachable, you are resilient, you are solution oriented coming to the table with great ideas, and you find the fun in a good challenge!Â 

    We will invest in you, as you invest in us. We believe that owning your growth and owning your success starts with you, but it's up to us to help provide the platform for learning, growing and building your career!

    Aircall is constantly moving forward. Weâ€™re building new roads to complete our journey, and weâ€™re taking people with us who have the same builder mentality.

    Letâ€™s grow together: Aircall is a place for those who dare to be bold and seek responsibility, excellence, and the opportunity to push themselves to new heights.

    Weâ€™re creating a place where great people trust one another and thrive together.

    People flourish at Aircall and now is the time to be part of the team and the journey weâ€™re on.

    Why join us?

    ğŸš€ Key moment to join Aircall in terms of growth and opportunities

    ğŸ’†â€â™€ï¸ Our people matter, work-life balance is important at Aircall

    ğŸ“š Fast-learning environment, entrepreneurial and strong team spirit

    ğŸŒ 45+ Nationalities: cosmopolite & multi-cultural mindset

    ğŸ’µ Competitive salary package & equity

    ğŸ¨ Medical, dental, and vision insurance is 100% covered

    ğŸ“ˆÂ 401k plan with company matching!

    âœˆï¸Â Unlimited PTO â€” take the time you need to come to work feeling great!

    â­ï¸Â Wellness, internet, and childcare reimbursements

    ğŸ’šÂ Generous parental leave policy

    DE&I Statement:Â 

    At Aircall, we believe diversity, equity and inclusion â€“ irrespective of origins, identity, background and orientations â€“ are core to our journey.Â 

    We pride ourselves on promoting active inclusion within our business to foster a strong sense of belonging for all. Weâ€™re working to create a place filled with diverse people who can enrich and learn from one another. Weâ€™re committed to ensuring that everyone not only has a seat at the table but is valued and respected at it by providing equal opportunities to develop and thrive.Â Â 

    We will constantly challenge ourselves to make sure that we live up to our ambitions around diversity, equity and inclusion, and keep this conversation open. Above all else, we understand and acknowledge that we have work to do and much to learn.

column57:
In concrete terms, you will be required to:Â 

  • Support the HRBP team and operational managers: Assist our HR professionals in managing and updating our HR database, ensuring the accuracy and completeness of the information.
  • Optimize user experience: Analyze user pain points and collaborate with our internal team to propose and implement optimal solutions.
  • Improve HR processes: Work closely with our team to identify, resolve and optimize existing HR processes, ensuring increased efficiency.
  • Support the steering of the HRBP dashboard: Assist the HRBP manager in monitoring and analyzing KPIs, contributing to informed decision-making.
  • Participate in HR projects: Depending on your interests, skills and the needs of the company, you will have the opportunity to get involved in various challenging and rewarding HR projects.

What we offer:Â 

  • An enriching experience within a dynamic and caring HR team.
  • The opportunity to develop your skills and acquire a global vision of HR processes.
  • A collaborative work environment where your ideas and initiatives are valued

During this apprenticeship, you will be accompanied by a tutor to answer your various questions.

Profile:

  • Education: Bac + 4/5 in Human Resources
  • Appetites for HRIS and C&B
  • Qualities required: rigor, organization, strength of proposal, curiosity
  • Languages: French, Professional English

Desired duration:Â  12 monthsÂ 

Desired Start:Â ASAP

Are you looking to learn in an international and dynamic environment, take part in large-scale projects and take on technical and organisational challenges?

Send us your application!

All our offers are open to people with disabilities.

And what's next?

Find all our offers on our career site:

https://careers.hr.ten.com/

To learn more about Technip Energies, please visit Youtube:Â 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8Mxj9h6vUjk

Find all our ESG commitments on the following page:

https://www.ten.com/sustainability

column28: Founded in 2005, Dailymotion is a global video platform built on a clever player and intuitive algorithm connecting over 350 million users to their personal news and entertainment space. It is also the player used by 90% of French media. So, for example, watching videos on Le Monde, Konbini, or Being Sport happens via their player technology. Today, 9 of 10 French internet users watch qualitative content in their ecosystem daily, making them the first French player. Dailymotion is part of the Vivendi media group with headquarters in Paris and offices in New York, Singapore, Montpellier, and Sophia Antipolis.
column36: Data Analyst â€“ Operations insights (All Genders)
column57:
Joining the Dailymotion Data Product Craft team means joining a diverse and dynamic team of more than 20 passionate data analysts and data scientists, to help us grow and build the evolution of Dailymotionâ€™s products.Â 

As a data analyst, you will be at the core of Dailymotionâ€™s data-driven strategy. You will be part of a cross-verticals team of other analysts responsible to support the product, business, and engineering teams with insights. You will collaborate closely with Product Managers, Monetization, Machine Learning, and Engineering teams.Â 

Your main goal will be to provide insights, based on which product decisions will be made. You will leverage complex and rich datasets to help decision makers better understand users experience on our platforms, player performances, monetization, ...Â 

Key responsibilitiesÂ Â 

  • Explore: Conduct exploratory analyses and leverage data to identify opportunities to improve business and optimize our products. Develop a deep understanding of our product and ecosystem for that purpose.Â Â 
  • Experiment: Advise on the experimentation strategy adapted to the need and context. Define, conduct, and analyze AB tests.Â Â 
  • Empower: Evangelize on the use of data in the company, train colleagues on analytics tools, build automated dashboards and assets to enable stakeholders to be as autonomous as possible with data.Â Â Â 
  • Measure: Analyze the impact of product releases on business metrics, as well as their impacts on products performances. Monitor the evolutions in our audience and supply explain them.Â Â 
  • Collaborate: Contribute to an iterative process of product improvement, collaborating with product managers, designers, developers, machine learning engineers and data engineers.Â Â 
  • Communicate: Share findings through clear visualizations, engaging presentations and straight to the point recommendations.Â Â 

Examples of analyses use cases: video recommendation models, search algorithms, supply optimization, player performances optimization, ...Â 

Our stackÂ Â 

  • Data Lake in Google Big Query: writing complex SQL queries is a daily practice (+ using R and Python for specific needs)Â Â 
  • Tableau and Google Data Studio for data visualizations and dashboardsÂ Â 
  • Internal A/B testing tool (Python based)Â Â 
Additional Information

At Dailymotion, weÂ empowerÂ candidates toÂ takeÂ action.Â If this job sounds like a great opportunity for you, be confident in your skills, we are always happy to meet you!Â If needed, we can accommodateÂ ourÂ recruitmentÂ process forÂ your special abilities.

  • Start Date: ASAP
  • Contract Type: Permanent & Full Time

The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. Itâ€™s a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyâ€¯in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,â€¯we leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware thatâ€¯everything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beautyâ€¯by leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovationâ€¯by offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heartâ€¯by ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurtureâ€¯lasting partnershipsâ€¯with our clients and suppliersâ€¯based on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of womenâ€¯and to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planetâ€¯by fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

Unleash Your Potential at Lâ€™OrÃ©alâ€™s Beauty Tech!

For more than a century, Lâ€™OrÃ©al has devoted itself solely to one business: Beauty. Present in 150 countries across five continents and with â‚¬42 billion consolidated sales, Lâ€™OrÃ©al is the global industry leader. With 37 global beauty brands across four divisions, Lâ€™OrÃ©al offers beauty for each covering all beauty categories and catering to all beauty desires. With the acquisition of the Australian brand AÄ“sop in 2023, the Group continues to expand its portfolio through targeted acquisitions as part of its drive to create the future of beauty.

Today, Lâ€™OrÃ©al includes more than 2,000 tech positions and is constantly growing. Beauty Tech is changing the game and leading the shift towards new consumer realities and a digital disruption. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

Beauty Tech is how we know our consumers intimately, augmenting their beauty journeys with unparalleled diverse and sustainable experiences. Beauty Tech equips the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic. With this ambition, Lâ€™OrÃ©al continues to recruit diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

YOUR FUTURE TEAM

The Data, CRM and Analytics team is dedicated to support business transformation and growth for the Professional Product Division (PPD).

PPD has become a true digital division keeping our mission to bring professional beauty for each, with hairstylist at heart and data as our accelerator.

Through our digital transformation journey, we are building a powerful B2B and B2B2C eco-system leveraging e-commerce, Online Education, CRM, Business Reps, Customer Care apps to serve customer and consumer needs.

These data acquisition touchpoints allowed us to create a unique O+O stylists knowledge (data asset) to boost business growth through segmentation, marketing activation, personalization and call to action.

As we look to leverage these opportunities and AI in our go-to-market, itâ€™s important that we continue to build upon our Data initiatives and strengthen our data quality.

What a day in the life of PPD Data Team looks like:

We have started our global PPD data journey, yet we need to continue make data ready for our business. To make it happen, we need a strong focus on data quality.

In this perspective, the candidate will need to:

  • Create awareness with pedagogy and proximity with all stakeholders on data quality.
  • Assess our current situation and provide clear guidelines and policies.
  • Monitor and lead remediation actions plan


Details of the mission:

Data management

  • Create proximity with stakeholders to understand, translate & qualify the data business requirement: scope, issues, objectives
  • Define critical objects & attributes
  • Audit the current situation and root cause main gaps
  • Define strategy to remediate existing issues and anticipate data quality standards for new sources
  • Lead, animate and orchestrate the implementation of remediation actions with support from the source app and data teams on the main gaps, from Division, Zones or Country entities
  • Animate PPD data teams and consult CDAO on quality best practices


Data-related policies

  • Ensure the respect of the product data group standards/policies
  • Document & communicate the new best practices/standards
  • Write new, policy-compliant processes where required


Quality monitoring and improvement

  • Implement KPIs to measure data quality and monitor deviation from acceptable quality levels
  • Define, communicate and follow-up remediation plans to increase data quality


THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have:
  • Between 3 and 5 years of professional experience
  • At least 3 years in data field
  • Data management, modeling, quality
  • Project management
  • Business oriented
  • Problem solving
  • Communication (oral and written)
  • Leadership


LET US GIVE YOU 6 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining Lâ€™OrÃ©al means joining a company that:
  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Offers a Hybrid Work Policy: 3 Days in Office, 2 Days Work from Home
  4. Provides many benefits: VIP staff shop offering our products at a preferential rate, a company restaurant & gym, 60% reimbursement of transportation subscription, a work council offering lots of employee discounts (social & cultural activities, holiday vouchers etc.) and much more!
  5. Provides a powerful and innovative HR policy : dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  6. Delivers a n Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and we do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. Thatâ€™s the beauty of Lâ€™OrÃ©al.


GOOD TO KNOW: THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS
  1. Interview with HR
  2. Interview with the hiring manager
  3. Interview with the business leader


We will be delighted to exchange with you!

Want to learn more about Lâ€™OrÃ©al Beauty Tech? C lick here.
column68:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. Itâ€™s a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyâ€¯in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,â€¯we leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware thatâ€¯everything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beautyâ€¯by leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovationâ€¯by offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heartâ€¯by ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurtureâ€¯lasting partnershipsâ€¯with our clients and suppliersâ€¯based on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of womenâ€¯and to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planetâ€¯by fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

Nos polices couvrent plus de 30 branches d'activitÃ© et 14 pays, et elles sont souvent incluses dans des programmes couvrant plus de 200 pays.Â Au sein de l'Ã©quipe Sinistres APAC Europe, notre objectif est de (i) piloter la stratÃ©gie et la transformation de nos activitÃ©s en matiÃ¨re de sinistres dans l'ensemble de nos zones gÃ©ographiques, (ii) soutenir les responsables des sinistres et leurs ~500 spÃ©cialistes des sinistres pour gÃ©rer les sinistres de nos entreprises clientes (en particulier sur les opÃ©rations, les donnÃ©es et les analyses et le service Ã  la clientÃ¨le), et (iii) surveiller les sinistres et les activitÃ©s de traitement des sinistres, ainsi que les risques et les contrÃ´les qui y sont liÃ©s. Pour ce faire, nous travaillons en Ã©troite collaboration sur les projets avec les responsables locaux des sinistres et leurs talents, ainsi qu'avec les centres d'excellence mondiaux des sinistres et les autres dÃ©partements de la Business Unit APAC Europe (souscription, conseil en risques, opÃ©rations et technologie, finances, gestion des clients et des courtiers, stratÃ©gie, gestion des risques, RH...). Nous renforÃ§ons notre Ã©quipe avec un(e) Senior Claims Data Analysts exceptionnel(le). Vous serez rattachÃ©(e) au responsable du service et de la transformation des sinistres, et vous aurez deux responsabilitÃ©s principales :- SÃ©curiser l'analyse de nos donnÃ©es sur une base mensuelle, trimestrielle et annuelle (au niveau APAC Europe et au niveau pays).Nous pensons que nous devons amÃ©liorer de maniÃ¨re significative la faÃ§on dont nous mesurons et analysons nos sinistres (pertes) et nos activitÃ©s de sinistres, notamment parce que la comprÃ©hension de notre portefeuille de sinistres et l'amÃ©lioration de nos opÃ©rations sont cruciales pour la rentabilitÃ© d'AXA XL.Â Pour y parvenir, votre rÃ´le sera crucial :Â - vous devrez remettre en question et analyser un ensemble de donnÃ©es, comprendre les moteurs de changement et traduire votre analyse en commentaires pertinents pour nos parties prenantes senior.Â - Vous devrez comprendre en profondeur les spÃ©cificitÃ©s et les rÃ©serves des indicateurs (dÃ©finitions, portÃ©e, calcul, y compris les objectifs), des systÃ¨mes de gestion des sinistres et des outils d'information gÃ©ographique. Pour Ãªtre pertinente, votre analyse reposera sur des interactions structurÃ©es et frÃ©quentes avec des experts de notre organisation, et vous serez responsable de la fiabilitÃ© des donnÃ©es.Â Les mÃ©triques comprendront des indicateurs de performance clÃ©s liÃ©s Ã  : (i) les activitÃ©s liÃ©es aux sinistres et les initiatives du plan d'action (productivitÃ©, dÃ©penses, Ã©conomies, personnel, recouvrement, fraude, service des sinistres, conformitÃ©...), (ii) les donnÃ©es sur les sinistres (grands sinistres (causÃ©s par l'homme et Nat Cats) et sinistres attritionnels ; sinistres sensibles ; litiges ; crises (par ex. Covid19, conflit en Ukraine) et tendances (par ex. inflation)) et (iii) les opÃ©rations de sinistres (mesures liÃ©es aux processus de traitement des sinistres (par ex. dÃ©lai moyen de la premiÃ¨re rÃ©serve) et aux flux de donnÃ©es sur les sinistres).Â - Contribuer Ã  la conduite du changement et Ã  l'amÃ©lioration continue en matiÃ¨re d'analyse des donnÃ©es.Â Nous pensons que notre organisation des sinistres doit Ã©voluer pour mieux saisir et analyser les donnÃ©es, Ã©tant donnÃ© que dans le cadre de notre feuille de route de transformation, nous allons (devoir) avoir accÃ¨s Ã  de plus en plus de points de donnÃ©es. Par consÃ©quentÂ - vous devrez Ãªtre un agent de changement au quotidien avec nos Ã©quipes Sinistres tout au long de leur parcours d'analyse des donnÃ©es : vous serez leur " source unique de vÃ©ritÃ© " pour les donnÃ©es dans le secteur Sinistres APAC Europe,Â - vous les aiderez Ã  garantir la robustesse des donnÃ©es sur leur pÃ©rimÃ¨tre et Ã  comprendre les moteurs d'analyse. En parallÃ¨le, vous contribuerez activement Ã  notre parcours de donnÃ©es en travaillant en Ã©troite collaboration avec nos parties prenantes mondiales en matiÃ¨re de sinistres et de donnÃ©es, par exemple en suggÃ©rant comment amÃ©liorer l'efficacitÃ© de nos processus de reporting (par exemple en limitant les entrÃ©es manuelles, en optimisant les flux de donnÃ©es) et comment donner la prioritÃ© aux dÃ©veloppements informatiques et de donnÃ©es.Â

column28:
The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. Itâ€™s a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyâ€¯in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,â€¯we leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware thatâ€¯everything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beautyâ€¯by leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovationâ€¯by offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heartâ€¯by ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurtureâ€¯lasting partnershipsâ€¯with our clients and suppliersâ€¯based on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of womenâ€¯and to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planetâ€¯by fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

column57:
NEO is a major Group worldwide program decided by the Executive Committee - that will create common, simplified, and harmonized ways of working that will enable us to operate cross-mÃ©tier processes in our plants, Countries, Zones & Divisions.

By optimizing processes among divisions, NEO will allow us to support our goto-market initiatives in a more consumer centric and agile fashion, while improving the user experience and workloads for our teams. Laying the foundation for Beauty Tech, NEO will contribute to group performance, by leveraging our data, and helping transform Lâ€™OrÃ©al into a â€œsmart companyâ€

Today NEO Program is at a turning point: shifting from a â€œdesign & build & pilots modeâ€ (phase 1) to a â€œrollout modeâ€ (phase 2) to deploy NEO in all Lâ€™OrÃ©al entities.

To support this second phase of the project the Data Tribe is at the heart: ensure quality of Data, from conception to migration, integrated approach of data for any kind of Master Data

WOULD YOU LIKE TO BE A PART OF THIS ADVENTURE?

Join our Data Tribe in the capacity of Master Data Management Expert

The scope of this dedicated Data Tribe overviews the full scope of Data from Master Data Management (MDM) to Data Migration. We are also industrializing several tasks to create a more scalable model for roll-out with the Data Migration Factory.

HEREâ€™S HOW YOU WILL HAVE A ROLE TO PLAY IN IT:

In the NEO Data Tribe, you will join one of our MDM squads. You are interested about all aspect around the data: Data Design, Data flows, Data governance. You understand the S/4 Business Partner concept (in particular Supplier and Employee) and its business usage. You will design the S/4 Data Model, understand how the data is produced upfront in our MDM EBX Tibco system. You will connect all S/4 satellite applications consuming the data and following the modern architecture best practices (API first).

As an expert, you may latterly contribute to the maintenance of the applications.

On the NEO Program we are working with AGILE methodology

MAIN MISSIONS ON THE JOB

  • Support the Master data domain â€œProduct ownersâ€ in the definition of the business needs and translate them into specification for development/improvement of IT applications.
  • With our IT skills, Deliver the functional specifications of the applications.
  • Analyze the impact of proposed solutions on the domain processes
  • Customize/configure the S/4 Business Partner, prepare functional tests and endorse responsibility for validating developments before application roll out.
  • Manage ongoing relationships with internal clients giving regular updates on developments and improvements.
  • Participate and deploy the change management activities by accompanying end users and providing trainings.
  • Provide support on escalated maintenance issues to the Service Delivery teams.

The desire for beauty has existed since the beginning of humanity. Itâ€™s a universal aspiration which crosses time, countries, and cultures.

Beauty is a powerful force that moves us.

We know that beauty is more than just looking good.
Beauty gives us confidence in who we are, in who we want to be, and in our relationships with others.

For over a century we have been dedicated to one sole vocation: creating beauty.
We remain true to the pioneering spirit of our founder and enjoy the unwavering support of his family, who have always accompanied our development.

Our goal is to offer each and every person around the world the best of beautyâ€¯in terms of quality, efficacy, safety, sincerity and responsibility to satisfy all beauty needs and desires in their infinite diversity.

Because beauty is a permanent quest, we harness the power of our innovation to continually enhance the performance of our products and services.
Because we value diversity,â€¯we leverage each of our brands to celebrate all expressions of beauty.

Because we strive to be exemplary with a long-term vision, we anchor our actions in our strong values and demanding ethical principles.

And because we are the global leader in beauty, we are aware thatâ€¯everything we do can have a meaningful impact.
Therefore:

We act to shape the future of beautyâ€¯by leveraging the best of science and technology, increasingly inspired by nature.

We act to drive social innovationâ€¯by offering the best working conditions, training, and social protection for our employees.

We act to build a business with inclusivity at its heartâ€¯by ensuring we are as diverse as the people we serve.

We act to nurtureâ€¯lasting partnershipsâ€¯with our clients and suppliersâ€¯based on mutual trust and collaboration.

We act to create value for all our shareholders, by sustaining a robust business model.

We act to champion the cause of womenâ€¯and to strengthen the communities with which we engage.

We act to protect the beauty of the planetâ€¯by fighting climate change, respecting biodiversity and preserving natural resources.

Who we are

Artefact is a new generation of data service provider, specialised in data consulting and data-driven digital marketing.

Our purpose?

What you will be doing: Key responsibilities

As a Senior Data Analyst, your role will encompass:

  • Conducting projects to accompany the transformation of your clientsâ€™ businesses through the effective collection, processing, and visualisation of data
  • Extracting valuable insights from our clientsâ€™ marketing-related data sources.

  • Actively contributing to the expertise level and competencies of the Data & Analytics team
  • Closely collaborate with the other divisions (Media & Activation, Creation, Consulting, Data Science and Data Engineer) to provide comprehensive services to your clients

Being a great tech role model

  • Demonstrating the skill and credibility required to ensure the success of our clientsâ€™ initiatives
  • Researching and developing new technical approaches to address problems efficiently
  • Staying up-to-date on developments within the industry, sharing best practices and actively contributing to Artefactâ€™s institutional knowledge
  • Embodying Artefactâ€™s values and inspiring others to do the same

Â 

Qualifications: Education & experience required

    • A minimum of 3 year of work experience in a data-driven working environment
    • 1 or more data collection (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, SQL database, CRM database, transactional data)
    • 1 or 2 programming languages among SQL, Python and/or R.
    • 1 or more Data visualisation tool (Tableau, Data Studio, Dataviz, R / Python dataviz libraries, ...)Â 

    In addition, you have the knowledge in one or more of the following technologies:

    • Google Cloud Platform resources (Big Query, Google Cloud Storage) or its equivalent in Azure or AWS

    • Advertising tool, linked to tracking and/or analytics in a marketing context (Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics, DMP, DSP, Adservers, DV 360...)Â Â 
    • ETL tool (Airflow, Dataiku, Dataflow, Dataprep...)Â 
    • Web application (R-Shiny, Python Flask) that you have industrialized

    Ideally you have:Â 

    • Knowledge of statisticsÂ 
    • Knowledge of machine learning and data engineering

What we are looking for

  • A Doer:Â you get things done and inspire your team to do the same
  • An Analyst:Â you LOVE data and think every company should take their decisions based on facts
  • A Pragmatist:Â you have a no-nonsense mindset that seeks for practical and realistic solutions
  • A Mentor:Â your clients and colleagues naturally seek you out for advice
  • An Adventurer:Â youâ€™re an entrepreneur constantly looking for business opportunities

Why you should join us

  • Artefact is the place to be:Â come and build the future of marketing
  • Progress:Â every day offers new challenges and new opportunities to learn
  • Culture:Â join the best team you could ever imagine
  • Entrepreneurship:Â you will be joining a team of driven entrepreneurs. We wonâ€™t give up until we make a huge dent in this industry!

Â 

Come join us!

The team

As a data consultant, you will be conducting projects from A to Z to accompany the transformation of our clientsâ€™ businesses.
