column28:
52 Entertainment is a leading e-gaming company, worldwide leader in various e-mind & strategy games such as Bridge, Tarot, Spades, Belote, Solitaire and e-sailing.
52 Entertainment is proud to be part of the French Tech 120 ranking.

Some of its most recognized brands are :

[Bridge Base Online] (https://www.bridgebase.com)
[Funbridge] (https://www.funbridge.com)
[Exoty] (https://exoty.com)
[Casualino] (https://casualino.com)
[Virtual Regatta] (https://www.virtualregatta.com)
[Loop Games] (https://play.google.com/store/apps/dev?id=5014688380385987684&hl=en&gl=US).

At the crossroads of gaming, entertainment and e-sport, 52 Entertainment provides unique experiences to its passionate communities.

Based in France with offices and people all around the globe, 52 Entertainment builds tomorrowâ€™s company based on People, Innovation and Mindset.
column57:
We are looking for an experienced Game Analyst -he/she/they- to join our Growth Team. You will be responsible for monitoring, analyzing, and optimizing key performance indicators across our products to help maximizing long term revenue and analyze and improve the effectiveness of the player life cycle.

You will do that by setting-up AB-tests of in-game features and create dashboards. You will regularly communicate your findings to Product, Management and Marketing teams to ensure your insights are used to inform decision making, to drive the growth of multiple games (focusing with the portfolio of Loop Games at first). You will work inside the Data Team (3 Data Analysts, 2 Data Engineers, 1 Analytics Engineer) and you will report to the VP of Growth.

This position is hybrid (3 days per week at the office) and located in Paris.

Team description

The Data team at 52 entertainment is full of talents working on Business & Financial, Product and Marketing KPIs. It is a cross-functional team that connects with all business units (US, Europe, Asia).

The Data team is operating remotely: we talk to each other on a daily basis and organize frequent virtual coffees â˜•ï¸.

Some are geeks, some are not, apply as you are, weâ€™re a diversity-friendly team ğŸ§• ğŸ‘§ğŸ½ ğŸ¥· ğŸ‘¨ğŸ¿ ğŸ‘© ğŸ¦¾. In our team everyone is to be treated equally regardless of sex, race, gender identification, disability, age, religion, â€¦

Missions

  • Support insight-driven decision making for several games

  • Collaborate with Product, Marketing, Customer Success, Live Ops on

  • - A/B testing initiatives

  • - Personalization strategies

  • - Launching new games on the market

  • Develop and define KPIs and models to assess game performance

  • Analyze large, complex data sets representing the behavior of millions of players

  • Design tests that investigate hypothesis and uncover customer insights

  • Create, own and manage an evolving AB test roadmap

  • Create and share actionable presentations and recommendations based on your findings to optimize the product roadmap and soft launch new games

Weâ€™re excited about you becauseâ€¦

  • Been working in the gaming industry for at least a couple of years, and know a few tricks to get players more engaged in game.

  • While most of your time will be spent working with other cross-functional leaders, you make sure to keep up to date with the latest trends in gaming and analytics.

  • Can easily communicate technical concepts to a wide variety of audiences - from engineers/scientists to business stakeholders - and navigate between big-picture and technical details.

  • Impressive ability to prioritize and weigh impact vs. effort and interest in how Analytics can help unlock faster growth and/or opportunities to increase margin and/or cut costs.

Benefits

  • Work in a start-up with exceptional growth

  • Highly interesting work environment with flat hierarchies, fast pace, and fun

  • If you have the potential, we will do everything to help you to achieve the highest level of personal and professional development.

  • High autonomy. No micro-managing here. When youâ€™ll be up to speed, youâ€™ll be given high-level directions, and you will often be free to solve problems in the way you feel is best.

  • Amazingly friendly Data team.
column61:
• First interviews from May 23rd onward.

  • Collecting applications until July 1st

  • Our hiring process is sequential: we know job seeking is a stressful time of life, and weâ€™ll make sure things are transparent from our side. If you donâ€™t pass step 2, we wonâ€™t waste your time on step3.

    ### Interview steps:

  1. [Visio-call] Preliminary interview where the scope of mission, our company, your aspirations, and salary compensation are discussed to see if we agree on the important things on both sides (30 min)

  2. [Case-study] Real world scenario, on some data problem + few questions to check that written communication is clear

  3. [Visio-call] Debrief from assignment + Background discussion to get to know you better

column36: Senior Marketing Data Analyst for Business Information
column57:
Our Mission

As part of the ongoing development of Business Information Services, Coface is recruiting a Senior Marketing Data Analyst for Business Information. This key role will report directly to the Group Marketing Director: Business Information at Coface. In this role you will oversee various aspects of Marketing performance operations and reporting, including producing systematic reporting and actional analytics covering pricing, product performance and usage, inbound demand generation, outbound lead generation analysis, GTM and communication impact analysis and pricing projects.

High level remit:

  • Key member of the BI Marketing team, championing an insight led approach to inform marketing decisions and to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing activities across go-to-market, lead generation, product and pricing.
  • Collaborate with the Distribution Squad Leadership (Sales, Marketing and Customer Success) to formulate and execute on insight led approach to corridor planning, go-to-market and lead generation marketing activities.
  • Lead development of best practice in measurement and evaluation of marketing activities, working closely with group colleagues to facilitate demonstrating the contribution of BI marketing activities.

What you will be doing:

  • Goal Setting and Strategy: responsible for surfacing insights, building reports and supporting an insight led approach to decision making for planning and implementation of marketing strategies across GTM, lead generation, product and pricing.
  • Reporting and Process Analysis: responsible for defining and setting up best practice processes on all aspects of marketing reporting so that we can track the revenue impact of all marketing activities and identify areas for continuous improvement.
  • Delivering Actionable Insights: identify insights that can drive revenue growth and improvements.
  • Pricing Analysis: gather and collate competitive pricing insights from the regions, drive the development and implementation of advanced pricing analytics to inform strategic decisions, assess the impact of annual price changes on market performance and revenue growth by creating reports and dashboards to track the effectiveness of pricing initiatives,
  • Pricing projects: work with the BI Pricing Director to streamline the quote-to-cash sales process by implementing a CPQ and CLM proof of concept and subsequent roll out, Â to enhance sales efficiency and customer satisfaction.
  • Regularly update: Senior Marketing and Commercial Leadership, as well as other key stakeholders on progress, challenges, and results.
  • Conduct sophisticated, detailed analysis and clearly communicate results so that decisions can be made with confidence.
column70: Experience & Skills:Minimum five years of experience in the areas of data modelling and visualization, preferably in a B2B or SaaS company.Proven ability in using statistical analysis, predictive modeling and explanatory modeling to identify trends.Experience designing and delivering Revenue Performance Insights, Sales coverage modeling, Sales productivity, revenue reporting, forecasting and pipeline reporting.Experience working within a high-growth technology company would be beneficialSelf-motivated, action-oriented, multi-tasking individual with a great sense of urgency and follow-throughYou must be a meticulous observer and be able to work under pressure since the job requires you to manage the entire revenue cycle from start to finish.End to end project management and ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.Ability to think strategically, but also have great attention to detail to facilitate program management execution.Proficiency in BI tools such Power BI for data visualization and insights, along with programming languages capabilities in Python, R, SQL for data analysis and automation.

column36: Workday Data and Analytics Senior manager (x/f/m)
column57:
What youâ€™ll do

Doctolib is looking for a dedicated and experienced People Data and Analytics, Senior manager to join our People Systems and Performance team.Â 

As a company, we strongly believe in harnessing the power of data and analytics to drive strategic decision
-making and enhance the employee experience.Â 

Reporting directly to the Head of People Systems and Performance, you will be responsible for leading the development, implementation, and management of our people analytics strategy. This role will play a crucial part in leveraging data
-driven insights to optimize talent management and C&B strategies, drive employee engagement and support strategic People initiatives.Â Â 

You will play a key role in building the HR data strategy and governance, ensuring a consistent reporting and analytics approach across functions (tools, processes, security and access) with a strong focus on user experience and business impact.Â 

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in HRIS solutions, particularly Workday, and a proven track record of translating data into actionable recommendations to support organizational objectives.Â 

Directly reporting to the Head of People Systems and Performance, you will work closely with the other product owners to make sure we are delivering a consistent solution.Â 

Your role will be to advise on the reporting system capabilities, new features and improvements as well as supporting the roadmap delivery.Â 

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to :Â 

DeliveryÂ 

  • In coordination with product owners, design, build and implement custom Workday reports and dashboards to provide real time insights to People teams and managers fostering a data
    -driven culture within the team.
  • Lead the configuration and maintenance of reporting with the objective to optimize and simplify our user experience (manager dashboard, HR dashboard, discovery board).
  • Lead efforts to analyze and optimize report performance
  • Collaborate with business stakeholders and People teams to understand their data needs and provide analytical support for decision
    -making processes.
  • Work closely with the PSP team to provide report and dashboarding solutions leveraging Workday capabilities (worksheet, discovery board, etc).Â 
  • Conduct regular system audits to ensure data accuracy, integrity, and compliance with company policies and regulations
  • Analyse and troubleshoot Workday issues related to reporting and provide timely resolutions.
  • Capacity to work with our Workday partners for reporting delivery on project/

Advisory and change management

  • Serve as a subject matter expert on Workday reporting and share best practices and knowledge with other team members.
  • Upskill the People team on reporting usage.
  • Maintain proper change management documentation to satisfy the companyâ€™s internal/external audit.
  • Connect with the Workday network, stay up to date with Workday updates, enhancements, and new features, and evaluate their applicability to Doctolib.Â 
  • Continuously seek opportunities to optimize and enhance Workday functionality to drive efficiency and improve the employee experience.

Who you are

If you donâ€™t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if:Â 

  • You have 3 toÂ 5 years of proven experience in Workday reporting : advanced, matrix, composite, BIRT, dashboard setup, calculated fields, reporting security, worksheet, discovery board..utilizing Workday Report Writer and Report Designer, as well as other organizational tools.
  • You have strong analytical skills and the ability to translate business requirements into technical solutions within the Workday environment
  • You have a strong sense of confidentiality
  • You have excellent communication skills, both written and verbal, to effectively collaborate with cross
    -functional teams
  • You speak fluent English;

It would be wonderful if :Â 

  • You have a multi
    -country experience and you desire to work with teams in multiple countriesÂ 
  • You have an entrepreneurial mindset with the ambition to transform the healthcare sector

What we offerÂ 

  • Employee share plan for every Doctoliber (BSPCE)
  • Free Health Insurance for you & your family
  • Quarterly or monthly bonus (based on your position)
  • Up to 14 days of RTTÂ 
  • A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office
    -based mode
  • Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per yearÂ 
  • Lunch voucher with Swile card
  • Work Council subsidy to refund part of sport club membership or creative class
  • Bicycle subsidy
  • Reimbursement of public transportation
  • Relocation support for international mobilities
  • Slean voucher for home
    -office furniture

The interview process

  • Talent Acquisition Interview
  • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Case Study with two hiring managersÂ 
  • Final Interview with People DirectorÂ 
  • Reference checkÂ 
  • OfferÂ 

Job Details

  • Permanent contract (CDI)
  • Full
    -time position
  • Workplace: Levallois HQ
  • Remuneration: fixed salary and variable based on objectives (to be defined according to profile)
  • This position is eligible for partial telecommuting

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone
- regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!Â 

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

column28:
Doctolib is a purpose-led company that strives for a healthier world with more than 2,800 employees across France, Italy, and Germany. Since 2013, Doctolib has been improving the daily lives of more than 340,000 healthcare professionals by providing them with new-generation technology and services.

Doctolib also serves more than 70 million patients, offering a fast, frictionless and secure journey for all their care needs.
column57:
What youâ€™ll do

Doctolib is looking for a Data excellence senior associate to strengthen the newly created HCP (Healthcare Practitioners) Data Platform team.

Your main missions will be to :

  1. Maximize our Prospects Target addressable market to enable Sales & Marketing growth
  2. Improve our database quality
  3. Join forces with our product and ops teams to scale our processes

As a Data excellence senior associate, you will be the main point of contact of our local sales & marketing teams based in France, Germany and Italy.Â 

Your responsibilities include but are not limited to:

Be the main point of contact regarding prospect data :

  • Work with all business teams to propose the right governance & business processes to ensure our data standards (eg. Sales, Marketing, Finance, Legal, Productsâ€¦)
  • Propose ambitious roadmaps to achieve our goals

Lead complex data excellence projects:

  • Lead, scope, drive & deliver data excellence projects (data analysis, data strategy, quality, data sourcing, Sales processes & change management, etc.)
  • Build scalable & lasting solutions by yourself or via our internal partners (Data Analytics, Data Operations, Product teams)
  • Ensure our database is efficient, complete & accurate and provide market knowledge on our prospect & competitors (Salesforces, MDM)

Who you are

If you donâ€™t meet all the requirements below but believe this opportunity matches your expectations and experience, we still encourage you to apply!

You could be our next team mate if you:

  • You graduated from a Business School or Engineering School;
  • You have at least 3 to 5 years of experience as a consultant, business or data analyst with strong business & data sense. You also have a fast and successful track record in a B2B SaaS company or consulting firm;
  • Youâ€™re highly proficient in writing SQL queries, including complex joins, and have extensive experience working with large databases.;
  • You have experience in leading projects
  • English is mandatory, French / German / Italian are a plus.

Now, it would be fantastic if you have:

  • Python knowledge & development experience
  • Experience with CRM (e.g. Salesforces) or MDM (Reltio)

What we offer

  • Employee share plan for every Doctoliber (BSPCE)
  • Free Health Insurance for you & your family
  • Quarterly or monthly bonus (based on your position)
  • Up to 14 days of RTT (except for Customer Care)
  • A flexible workplace policy offering both hybrid and office
    -based mode
  • Flexibility days allowing to work in EU countries and the UK 10 days per yearÂ 
  • Lunch voucher with Swile card
  • Work Council subsidy to refund part of sport club membership or creative class
  • Bicycle subsidy
  • Relocation support for international mobilities
  • Slean voucher for home
    -office furniture

The interview processÂ 

  • HR screen interview
  • Hiring Manager Interview
  • Case study + Case Restitution
  • At least one reference check

Job details

  • Permanent position
  • Full TimeÂ 
  • Workplace : Levallois Perret or Nantes
  • Start date : ASAP
  • Remuneration : fix + bonus on objectives (according to your profile)

A stock options plan for every Doctoliber

At Doctolib, we believe in improving access to healthcare for everyone
- regardless of where you come from, what you look like. This translates into our recruitment process: Doctolib is an equal opportunity employer. We don't just accept diversity at Doctolib, we respect and celebrate it!

The more diverse ideas are heard, the more our product will truly improve healthcare for all. You are welcome to apply to Doctolib, regardless of your gender, religion, age, sexual orientation, ethnicity, disability, or place of origin. If you have a disability, let us know if there's any way we can make the interview process smoother for you!Â 

All the information transmitted via this form is processed by Doctolib for the purpose of managing applications. For more information on how Doctolib processes your application data, click here.

If you wish to exercise your rights or if you have any questions about the processing of your data, you can write to us at hr.dataprivacy@doctolib.com.

column28:
AXA Climateâ€™s purpose is to make regenerative business universal.

Reducing our negative impact on the planet is not enough. Our collective challenge is to switch from extractive companies to regenerative companies. To that end, we are transforming our business models, our organizations and our collective missions. And this transformation movement drives us.

We are changing the paradigm: our companies are living beings, nested in the living world. To serve this mission we have four lines of business:Â 

  • Training: digital and scientific content that gets all employees engaged by giving them skills and tools
  • Consulting: having an impact at the local level through concrete adaptation actions
  • Insurance and financing: securing those who adapt and have an impact
column57:
ğŸŒÂ Who we are

AXA Climate is a Committed Climate Insurer. We accompany our clients in their sustainability transition journey, we feed our entire offer with best-in-class climate expertise, and we fully leverage satellite in our products. We are reinventing the insurance business to support actors engaged in sustainable transition.

ğŸ¦‹Â Working at AXA Climate

AXA Climateâ€™s desire is to innovate in terms of corporate culture so that everyone can flourish and develop all its potential.Â Our culture is therefore â€œorganicâ€ organization, without a fixed hierarchy, to continuously adapt to the market, aligned with our aspirations.

We are a team of 150+ collaborators (underwriters, climate & agri experts, and tech & data experts), spread over the 5 continents and we are all driven by the same focus on impact, leveraging the full AXA ecosystem.

âœ¨Â Your job as Operations & Data Analyst

1. Data management and analysis for quarterly financial reports on closings and monitoring of profitability.

2. Underwriting operations liaising with our partners in France and abroad for:

- the booking of insurance and reinsurance structures,

- the brokers accreditation,

- the collection of premiums,

- the management of parametric insurance claims.

column14: Accounting, FinTech / InsurTech, SaaS / Cloud Services
column28:
Pennylaneâ€™s mission is to enable business owners to make the right financial decisions and accountants to focus on their advisory role.

What does it mean? Pennylane provides a platform that allows business owners and their accountants to collaborate efficiently and grow their businesses.

With Pennylane, executives make better decisions and simplify their financial management. Without leaving the platform, they can access all of their reliable, up-to-date, actionable data; pay for purchases; and manage their invoicing. Accountants can focus on their advisory role by saving time on data entry and retrieval of documents, thanks to Pennylaneâ€™s numerous automations.

Launched in 2020, Pennylane team has already achieved great things : ğŸš€ğŸ’š

  • Thousands of SMEs
  • Recognized as one of the hottest startup in Paris in 2021 The Wired.
  • â‚¬84 millions raised so far though Partech, Sequoia investors, Global - Founders Capital and Kima Ventures
  • Hundreds of French accounting firms use Pennylane every day
  • And 220+ Pennylaners from 15 different countries building the best platform for european SMEs and their accountants

Our Values :

  • SUPPORTING SMES : We solve real issues for real people and never lose touch with the reality of our users

  • COMMUNITY OF BUILDERS : We focus on impact and take pride in being a hands-on team.

  • RADICAL TRUST : At Pennylane, trust is not earned, itâ€™s given.
column57:
Are you looking to have an impact on the daily life of millions of entrepreneurs in France and Europe?

Do you thrive in a trustful, fast-paced environment?

Do you feel like our Engineering principles are aligned with your vision?

Then Pennylane might be the right place for you â€”Â and you, might be the perfect fit for this role ğŸ™‚

Our vision

We aim to become the most beloved financial Operating System of European SMEs.

We help business owners get rid of the time consuming hassle of handling accounting and finance, while giving them access to key information that they can use to make better decisions.

Meanwhile, weâ€™re helping accountants. By using Pennylane, rather than doing manual and repetitive tasks, they can spend more time advising and guiding their clients.

About us

Pennylane is one of the fastest growing Fintechs in France (and soon to be in Europe!)

In 4 years of existence, weâ€™ve managed to:

ğŸ’» Make ourselves known as a groundbreaking accounting and financial software for small businesses and their accountants

ğŸ’° Raise a total of â‚¬84 millions, including from Sequoia ğŸŒ², the famous fund from the Silicon Valley who invested early in companies like Google, Facebook, Airbnb, Stripe, Paypal and much more...

ğŸ‘¨â€ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ‘§â€ğŸ‘¦ Grow from 7 cofounders to 350+ happy Pennylaners: weâ€™re now recognized as one of the greatest places to work in France (but also remotely), with a 5/5 rating on Glassdoor and an e-NPS of 94

ğŸŒ Build an international environment with more than 30 nationalities, with a strong remote-friendly culture, where 40% of the employees are already working from all parts of Europe

ğŸ¤ Earn the trust of thousands of customers and accounting firms and obtain outstanding ratings

WHY this position is of utmost importance to reach our mission

At Pennylane, every decision that is not backed by data is likely to be challenged (when data is available of course). This culture is embraced by the leadership team, and actively promoted everywhere. The role of the data team is to make this possible by treating data like a production asset, making it available company-wide, and using it proactively to improve Pennylaneâ€™s user experience.

By joining us as a Senior Data Analyst, you will have a pivotal role in large projects, bringing your business sense and analytical thinking to help us meet our high delivery standards.

HOW you will contribute to the company

As a Senior Data Analyst, you will be part of the Science & Analytics team (7+ people), inside the Data department (18+ people).

- You will proactively use data to identify opportunities to grow our business or improve our processes.

- You will be a real sparring partner for Product & Operation leaders, feed their strategy by anticipating the most important product and business questions, and leverage your data & statistical skills to answer them.

- You will drive our self-service approach to analytics, by understanding our colleagueâ€™s needs in their use of data, and promoting a data driven culture. The Science & Analytics team is also fully in charge of creating data models in the Data Warehouse (using dbt).

- You will contribute to shaping the Data Engineering roadmap to deliver the best experience for your colleagues on the data platform.

WHAT you can expect from your life at Pennylane

Within one month:

- You will learn everything about our company, our teams, and our vision during the first onboarding week.

- You will get familiar with our stack, and have delivered a few small projects which will give you a concrete taste of our tools & processes.

- You will be given time to meet your future stakeholders, and gain a deep knowledge of our product and operations.

Within 3 months:

- You will be fully in charge of supporting some area of the business (product or operations), prioritizing your tasks with decision makers from this area.

- You will be confortable with our technical stack (Python, Redshift, dbt, PySpark).

- You will contribute to larger cross-company projects.

Within 6 months:

- You will proactively contribute to the teamâ€™s roadmap.

- You will work with engineers and data practitioners on improving our stack and data platform.

- You will share your learnings and best practices within the team.

And beyond: the data team will continue growing with the company

Which means:

- Opportunities to recruit and mentor new team members,

- Increased accountability in project leadership,

- Responsibilities to design and implement new processes, tools and best practices to make sure that your team works even more efficiently.

What do we do to make your work life easier

ğŸ¢ You'll be able to work remotely from anywhere in Europe, as long as your contract allows you to, however, we would prefer for you to be based in Paris most of the time, as this is a Hybrid role.

ğŸ’µ Youâ€™ll have a compensation package

ğŸ“ˆ You'll get company shares to enjoy a piece of the success story you're building with us

ğŸ¡ Youâ€™ll have a budget to turn your home into a more comfortable workspace, as well as a monthly allowance to work from a coworking space whenever you feel like it

â›¹ï¸Through our partner Gymlib, youâ€™ll have access to 8000 fitness spaces in Europe and more than 300 activities related to wellness

ğŸ‡¬ğŸ‡§ Youâ€™ll have access to Busuu to perfect your english or your french

ğŸ’» Youâ€™ll get the latest Apple equipment

ğŸ‰ Youâ€™ll be part of a vibrant social community : we do lots of sports together (Foot, running, climbing...), we love to hang out and have a drink together (thursday afterwork drinks on our rooftop is a usual thing. Twice-a-year we do company seminars, last time we went on a trip to the French Alps and it was fabulous !)

And.. If you're based in France :

ğŸ¢ Youâ€™ll be able to work fully from your home or any co-working space in France, or from our wonderful office in the center of Paris

ğŸYouâ€™ll get 10 additional days off (to the 25 standard ones) to rest and do what you love each year

ğŸœ Youâ€™ll have lunch credits (Swile card) to buy your favorite food every day

ğŸ¥ Youâ€™ll have a great healthcare cover (Alan Blue) to take care of yourself and your family

We're working on providing those last advantages to our people based outside of France as well, but it can be quite more complex depending on different countries.

What does the recruitment process look like?

- A first interview with RÃ©mi, Tech Recruiter (30 min)

- A case study interview to discuss a topic closely related to one of our priorities (75 min)

- A past project interview to hear about your experience (60 min)

- An interview with our Tech & Product leaders to discuss our company culture (30 mn)

Who are we looking for ?

You may have noticed that there was no section listing the skills or qualities required to apply for this specific job. Researches have shown that some people are less likely to apply than others, if they donâ€™t feel like they meet the full list of criteria. So we have decided to take it down entirely.

We have tried to give you as much details as we could about the purpose, missions and environment of this role; it is now up to you to tell us if you think this is a position in which you could a) have fun and b) bring value to our company.

If youâ€™re hesitating, we encourage you to apply anyway: worst case scenario, you might lose a few minutes, and in the best case, it will be the start of a meaningful and long-lasting collaboration.

We also want to emphasize that we fully embrace diversity and that weâ€™re doing our best to create a safe and inclusive environment. We are committed to providing an equal employment opportunity regardless of gender, sexual orientation, origin, disabilities, or any other traits that make you who you are. If anything, diversity makes us a more fun place to work at.

To end with a humble illustration of our commitment, weâ€™ve recently signed the Pacte ParitÃ© to set concrete goals in building a better and more inclusive workplace in the years to come.

#LI-Remote

column28:
Better & Stronger est un cabinet de conseil et dâ€™exÃ©cution en marketing digital crÃ©Ã© en 2010, en plein cÅ“ur de Lyon.
Notre mission est dâ€™aider les entreprises Ã  designer et dÃ©velopper la composante digitale de leur business. Nous le faisons en combinant conseil en stratÃ©gie, crÃ©ativitÃ©, et maÃ®trise de la donnÃ©e pour permettre un marketing digital performant.

Nous pouvons aider nos clients Ã  :

  • Mettre la donnÃ©e au centre de leur marketing digital
  • Le storytelling et les services crÃ©atifs associÃ©s

column68:
Solution BI Canada, powered by the Solution BI Group, is a subsidiary company specializing in all areas of business intelligence and the transformation of finance and performance processes.

Present since 2016 in the Quebec and Toronto market, it brings its expertise in performance management, data governance and analysis, and data visualization.

Solution BI is a certified partner to the most powerful database management solutions such as Oracle, MicroStrategy, Microsoft BI, Informatica, as well as cloud solutions such as Snowflake, Datavault and Vena for finance.

BI solutions, people behind your data-driven strategy!

Les compÃ©tences technologiques qui te seront les plus utiles sontâ€¯:Expertise sur un cloud data warehouse comme Snowflake,MaÃ®trise du langage de programmation Python et dâ€™un framework comme Spark ou Pandas,MaÃ®trise avancÃ©e du SQL (optimisation de requÃªte, bonnes pratiques)MaÃ®trise dâ€™un langage dâ€™infra-as-code comme Terraform et dâ€™un outil de CI/CD,MaÃ®trise avancÃ©e de Git.Mais avant tout, ce sont tes compÃ©tences humaines qui seront tes principaux atoutsâ€¯:Ta capacitÃ© Ã  animer une Ã©quipe,Ton envie de partager tes connaissances,Le sens du service et la passion de la tech qui tâ€™animent.Tes qualificationsPour un Lead Data Engineer, voici nos attentesâ€¯:Au moins 5 annÃ©es dâ€™expÃ©rience pendant lesquelles tu as jouÃ© un rÃ´le clÃ© dans la mise en production de plateformes de donnÃ©es modernes,Un diplÃ´me dâ€™ingÃ©nieur ou un master 2 en informatique,Un niveau dâ€™anglais professionnel avec la capacitÃ© dâ€™animer des ateliers techniques et fonctionnels,Un trÃ¨s bon niveau de production Ã©crite

Aux cÃ´tÃ©s des clubs, ligues et des fÃ©dÃ©rations sportives, Betclic contribue au dynamisme Ã©conomique du secteur du sport.

Betclic, dont le siÃ¨ge franÃ§ais est Ã  Bordeaux, est une entreprise multiculturelle et internationale comptant plus de 1050 collaborateurs rÃ©partis dans 6 pays dâ€™Europeâ€¯: France, Italie, Malte, Pologne, Portugal et CÃ´te dâ€™Ivoire.
column57:
WE ARE BETCLIC

Betclic is a tech company specializing in online gaming and a leader 

            in sports betting in several European countries. Every day, Betclic is             committed to fueling the passion for sports by providing players with             the best entertainment experience through innovative cutting-edge             technologies, ensuring a safe and healthy gaming environment.Â </p><p>Betclic, headquartered in Bordeaux, France, is a multicultural and             international company with nearly 950 employees spread across 5 European             countries: France, Italy, Malta, Poland, and Portugal.Â </p><p>Do you have a passion for the world of sports and gaming? Do you             enjoy challenges and contributing to collective efforts? Join the             adventure!Â </p><p><strong>ENTER THE GAME</strong></p><p>You will join the Data Analytics team, which is part of a larger Data team that also includes Data Science, Data Product Management and Product Analytics teams.</p><p>The Analytics team mission is to grow the business by identifying critical insights and high value opportunities. You'll integrate into a fast growing team of +30 passionate individuals tackling challenges of all sorts: from scaling marketing campaign analytics to building complex customer segmentations to predicting the outcome of the next football game.</p><p></p><p><strong>YOUR ROLE WITHIN BETCLIC</strong></p><p>As a Senior Gaming Data Analyst, you will join the Gaming Analytics team, where you will support the Gaming team on various projects to improve and build a best-in-class product</p><p>Your mission will be:</p><ul>             <li>Partner with product and business      leaders to scope out their challenges and work collaboratively to      find the right solutions to improve core KPIs</li>             <li>Work with product owners in creating      AB test strategies that yield actionable results </li>             <li>Proactively identify areas of      friction for customers and work with the relevant stakeholders to improve      the UX</li>             <li>Feed into betting squad roadmap      prioritization by leveraging your business knowledge to produce convincing      analysis</li>             <li>Work with stakeholders within the      Betting team to enhance their oversight of performance with KPIs tailored      to their needs</li>            </ul><p>What you can expect to work on:</p><ul>             <li>Conduct analysis into product      features & promotions that have been deployed and measure the      performance of them with recommendations of improvements.</li>             <li>Work on mechanics of promotional      games to find the optimal parameters to meet business objectives</li>             <li>Contribute to the development of      data products from conceptualizating the need, define KPIs and analysing      output </li>            </ul><p></p><p><strong>WHO WE ARE LOOKING FOR?</strong></p><p>Minimum Requirements:</p><ul>             <li>You have at least 3 year of Data      Analytics experience (internships included)</li>             <li>You have a degree in a Quantitative      field i.e Math's, computer science, engineering, statistics, economics etc</li>             <li>Proactively anticipate the needs of      stakeholders </li>             <li>Business-minded - you can understand      the business problems and produce an analysis catered to their needs.</li>             <li>You have an excellent understanding      of analytical methodologies and the process to deliver analysis.</li>             <li>Contribute to roadmap planning with      concise projects that can add value to the team</li>             <li>Excellent understanding of      probabilities and applications to real world situations</li>             <li>Excellent understanding of      statistics and deterministic modeling</li>             <li>Good understanding of SQL with the      ability to extract and manipulate data autonomously. </li>             <li>Curious and can ask questions to try      to understand the problems. </li>             <li>You have great communication and      presentation skills.</li>             <li>You are agile and able to adapt to a      fast-paced environment.</li>            </ul><p>Highly desirable:</p><ul>             <li>Previous experience in the IGaming      industry </li>             <li>You are familiar with at least one      Data visualization tool : Tableau, PowerBI etc </li>             <li>Good understanding of stochastic      modeling</li>             <li>You know a programming language to      produce simulations.</li>             <li>You are aware of Git &      versioning concepts.</li>             <li>Understanding of Betting principles      (i.e odds probabilities, closing line value, margin application,      differentiation of limits etc)</li>            </ul><p></p><p><strong><strong>WHAT ARE THE RECRUITMENTÂ </strong><strong>STEPS?</strong></strong></p><ul>             <li>First introductory      meeting with our Talent Acquisition teams</li>             <li>Technical (SQL &      Analytics) and personality test</li>             <li>Business understanding      interview with Hiring Manager</li>             <li>Cultural fit interview      with Hiring Manager and Head of Analytics, Talent Acquisition and/or      Business partner</li>             <li>Open discussion with our      CDO and/or Senior Gaming Stakeholder</li>            </ul><p></p><p><strong>WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT?</strong></p><ul>             <li>Open-minded and      respectful team mates with a sense of humor and passionate with the job!</li>             <li>An attractive      compensation package</li>             <li>Access to a state of the      art data stack (Snowflake, Airflow, git, Tableau,...)</li>             <li>Complex challenges with      well structured data thanks to our BI team, let's start analyzing</li>             <li>Vibrant analytical      topics: imagine the future of online gambling</li>             <li>Regular training on      skills you want to develop further (ML, Stats but also French or English      classes)</li>             <li>25 days of paid leave      and 10 days of compensatory rest</li>             <li>A Ticket Restaurant      cardÂ® funded to the tune of 50% (10 euros/day)</li>             <li>A health insurance      policy covered up to 100% for you and your children</li>             <li>A transport subscription      supported up to 50% or an annual premium of sustainable mobility (200      euros for the journey home-work in sustainable transport)</li>             <li>A mobility pack (moving      aid)</li>             <li>Work flexibility covered      by a telecommuting agreement</li>             <li>A constant focus on      skills development with a personalized annual training program</li>             <li>Career development in an      international environment</li>             <li>Unique premises with a      rooftop designed to enjoy regular entertainment, breaks and lunches in the      sun in front of the â€œ<em>CitÃ© du Vinâ€</em></li>            </ul><p><strong>Indefinite contract</strong>Â position to be filled as soon as possible.All of our positions are open to people with disabilities.</p>

column28:
VO2 Group is a global Tech & digital consulting Company.

We harness the power of technologies to propel iconic brands and industry leaders into an era of endless possibilities.

Our clients are international brands in retail, luxury, banking, insurance and industry â€¦ We work with half of the CAC40 (in particular LVMH, Clarins, Chanel, Renault, Orange, BNP â€¦ ) and startups like Mirakl.

We are : GPTW, Happy At Work, 1st on impact ESG rewarded by Choose My Company, Growth Champion - Les Echos, and we received the Syntec / KPMG customer relationship award. Our ambition is to become the leading independent French technology group.

We are The Bright Side Of Tech.
column57:
Tech and Digital Consulting Company, VO2 Group is an independent international enterprise that unleashes the transformative power of technologies to propel major brands into an era of endless possibilities.

As the leading independent French group, established on equal terms, we operate from Paris, Lille, Montreal, Toronto, Shanghai, Casablanca, Jerusalem, and New York with over 700 consultantsÂ  Â Â 

As a global player in customer experience, we engage in everything from business and digital strategy, IT, and data to the design of web and mobile products, as well as the creation of tailor-made digital experiences.

We are the Growth Champion according to LES ECHOS for ESNs in 2023.

We have won the ESG WeImpact Happy at Work 2023 award.

VO2 GROUP, The Bright Side Of Tech.

Job Responsibilities

As a Data Analysis Dataiku Consultant within our data-specialized team your responsibilities will include:

Collaborating with clients to understand their business objectives and data analysis requirements.

Designing and developing data pipelines and workflows in Dataiku to ingest, transform, and prepare data for analysis.

Conducting exploratory data analysis to identify patterns, trends, and anomalies in the data.

Building and deploying machine learning models using Dataiku's automated machine learning capabilities.

Developing and maintaining Dataiku dashboards and visualizations to present data insights to stakeholders.

Integrating external data sources and APIs into Dataiku projects for comprehensive analysis.

Providing technical support and guidance to clients on Dataiku-related issues and best practices.

Collaborating with data engineers and other team members to optimize Dataiku workflows and processes.

Staying updated on industry trends and advancements in data analysis and machine learning techniques.

Contributing to the development and improvement of data analysis methodologies and tools within the company.

Profile Desired

We are seeking a candidate with the following qualifications and attributes:

Strong proficiency in Dataiku, including data preparation, modeling, and deployment functionalities.

Experience in data analysis, machine learning, and statistical analysis techniques.

Knowledge of programming languages such as Python or R for data manipulation and analysis.

Familiarity with SQL for querying and manipulating databases.

Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.

Strong communication skills, with the ability to effectively convey complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.

Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team environment.

A proactive approach to learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies in the data analysis field.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Data Science, Statistics, or a related field. A master's degree is preferred but not required.

Relevant certifications in Dataiku or related data analysis tools would be advantageous.

column68:
VO2 Group is a global Tech & digital consulting Company.

We harness the power of technologies to propel iconic brands and industry leaders into an era of endless possibilities.

Our clients are international brands in retail, luxury, banking, insurance and industry â€¦ We work with half of the CAC40 (in particular LVMH, Clarins, Chanel, Renault, Orange, BNP â€¦ ) and startups like Mirakl.

We are : GPTW, Happy At Work, 1st on impact ESG rewarded by Choose My Company, Growth Champion - Les Echos, and we received the Syntec / KPMG customer relationship award. Our ambition is to become the leading independent French technology group.

We are The Bright Side Of Tech.

column28:

We harness the power of technologies to propel iconic brands and industry leaders into an era of endless possibilities.

Our clients are international brands in retail, luxury, banking, insurance and industry â€¦ We work with half of the CAC40 (in particular LVMH, Clarins, Chanel, Renault, Orange, BNP â€¦ ) and startups like Mirakl.

column57:
Tech and Digital Consulting Company, VO2 Group is an independent international enterprise that unleashes the transformative power of technologies to propel major brands into an era of endless possibilities.

As the leading independent French group, established on equal terms, we operate from Paris, Lille, Montreal, Toronto, Shanghai, Casablanca, Jerusalem, and New York with over 700 consultantsÂ  Â Â 

As a global player in customer experience, we engage in everything from business and digital strategy, IT, and data to the design of web and mobile products, as well as the creation of tailor-made digital experiences.

We are the Growth Champion according to LES ECHOS for ESNs in 2023.

We have won the ESG WeImpact Happy at Work 2023 award.

VO2 GROUP, The Bright Side Of Tech.

Job Responsibilities

As a Data Project Manager Consultant within our data-specialized team, your responsibilities will include:

Leading end-to-end data projects from initiation to completion, ensuring deliverables are met on time and within budget.

Collaborating with clients to define project scope, objectives, and requirements, and managing stakeholder expectations throughout the project lifecycle.

Developing project plans, timelines, and resource allocations, and effectively communicating project status updates to all stakeholders.

Managing project risks and issues, and implementing mitigation strategies to minimize project disruptions.

Overseeing data project teams, including data engineers, data analysts, and other stakeholders, and facilitating collaboration and knowledge sharing among team members.

Ensuring adherence to project management best practices and methodologies, and driving continuous improvement initiatives to optimize project delivery processes.

Conducting quality assurance reviews and assessments to ensure project deliverables meet quality standards and client expectations.

Providing technical expertise and guidance on data-related issues and challenges, and facilitating resolution of technical issues as needed.

Experience in managing TMA (Third-Party Maintenance Agreement) projects, ensuring SLA compliance and effective resolution of incidents and service requests.

Staying updated on industry trends and advancements in data management and project management methodologies.

Profile Desired

We are looking for a candidate with the following qualifications and attributes:

Proven experience in project management, preferably in data-related projects.

Strong leadership and interpersonal skills, with the ability to effectively lead and motivate project teams.

Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills, with the ability to interact with clients and internal stakeholders at all levels.

Solid understanding of project management methodologies, such as Agile, Scrum, or Waterfall, and experience in applying them to deliver successful projects.

Experience in managing Third-Party Maintenance Agreement (TMA) projects, ensuring SLA compliance and effective resolution of incidents and service requests.

Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities, with a proactive approach to identifying and addressing project risks and issues.

Ability to work under pressure and manage multiple priorities simultaneously, while maintaining attention to detail and quality.

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field. A Project Management Professional (PMP) certification is a plus.

Experience in the data industry or familiarity with data management concepts and technologies is preferred but not required.

Flexibility to adapt to changing project requirements and business needs, and a willingness to learn and grow in a dynamic environment.

VO2 Group is a global Tech & digital consulting Company.

We harness the power of technologies to propel iconic brands and industry leaders into an era of endless possibilities.

Our clients are international brands in retail, luxury, banking, insurance and industry â€¦ We work with half of the CAC40 (in particular LVMH, Clarins, Chanel, Renault, Orange, BNP â€¦ ) and startups like Mirakl.

We are : GPTW, Happy At Work, 1st on impact ESG rewarded by Choose My Company, Growth Champion - Les Echos, and we received the Syntec / KPMG customer relationship award. Our ambition is to become the leading independent French technology group.

We are The Bright Side Of Tech.

column68:
WHO ARE THEY ? ğŸ‘€
Partoo is a B2B SaaS scale-up who is committed to helping local businesses, large companies or SMEs to get closer to their customers. To do this, they have developed an all-in-one platform and different solutions that revolve around 3 value propositions: Get Found, Get Chosen and Get Clients.

Through these 3 propositions, they have developed several products that adapt to changes in the customer purchasing journey:

ğŸ” Get Found

  • Presence: Synchronize store information on main platforms (Google, Facebook, Waze, etc.), directories and GPS.
  • Store Locator: Help customers find the store thatâ€™s right for them with up-to-date local data and dedicated filters on retailer websites.
  • Social Media: Manage posts on Facebook, Google, Instagram, etc.

ğŸ¯ Get Chosen

  • Review: Centralize, reply to and analyze customer reviews received on Google and Facebook.
  • Booster: Get additional positive reviews on Google through SMS and QR codes.
  • Messages: Centralize and reply to all chat messages received via Google Business Messages, Messenger and soon also via Instagram, whatsapp, etc.

column57:
Whatever their stage of life, we provide over 108 million customers with the products and services they need to progress. From insurance to personal protection, and savings to wealth management, no matter the need weâ€™re always there for them. And weâ€™re always there for our employees. In 50 countries, we work hard to inspire pride and a sense of belonging in our people. To provide opportunities that challenge them, inspire them, and reward them. And to create a culture thatâ€™s open, supportive, and empowering. Because we know thatâ€™s the real secret to success â€“ and the best way for us to keep building a better world for both our customers and the talented people who put them first.

Your work environment:

The headquarters of the AXA Group (GIE AXA) brings together our corporate activities. It provides guidance and support to subsidiaries around the world, to ensure the coordination and monitoring of the Group's global strategy, the application of its standards, the consistency of commercial approaches and the sharing of best practices. The headquarters gathers approximately 1000 employees and is distinguished by its strong international culture (45 nationalities), which makes it a rich and stimulating place to work.

Within the Group, you will join the Group Investment Department

Within this Department, you will be part of the PI2 team.

The PI2 team collaborate with various suppliers (PBRC, RM, asset managers, rating agencies, Group IT, etc.) and clients (Group and local, finance, investment, risk, compliance, etc.).

The main challenges are:

  • To manage the complexity of huge numbers of complex investments, with new type of investments coming frequently, o to keep up to date with latest IT developments (cloud-based tools, AI, etc.)
  • To manage the multiple stakeholders which interests may not be aligned
  • To have the solidity of a robust process under the scrutiny of various internal controls and the agility to adapt rapidly to market crisis or other circumstances.

Detailed missions and responsibilities:

Provide the Group Investment professionals and other stakeholders with cutting-edge information systems fed by quality data to monitor the investments.

Main Clients:

  • Group Monitoring team
  • Group Investment Committee
  • GIA Senior Management
  • Center of Expertise
  • Investor Relations
  • Local Operating Units (Investment / Allocation Teams)

Key accountabilities :

  1. PI2 Technical Platform management
  • Contribute to the PI2 Infrastructure evolution o Include new functionalities for business needs (full entity onboarding, data market placeâ€¦)
  • Collaborate with all IT experts within the Group (AXA GO, GIE DSI, Legal, Security)
  • Ensure that the documentation is up to date and reliable
  • Participate on the trainning on PI2 Community (Local Operating Units)

2. Monthly productionÂ 

  • Produce reliable, structured and timely monthly reports (including quantitative, qualitative et commented analyses)Â 
  • Ensure the review of the overall data quality and implement necessary controls for their review
  • Regular update of the report instructions and specifications
  • Interact and support other department teams e.g. Group Credit Team (GCT), Asset Liability Management Team (ALM), Group Investment Solutions (GIS), Group Risk Management (GRM), Investor Relations, Accounting (PBRC) and local entities
  • Manage daily data flows from various providers

Ekimetrics is a leader in data science and AI-powered solutions. For over 16 years, weâ€™ve pioneered the use of AI and advanced data science applied to unified marketing measurement, holistic business optimization and broad-ranging sustainability goals.

Our goal: Combine high impact solutions with long-term sustainable business purposes.

Ekimetrics Hong Kong office has been awarded the â€˜Best Companies to work for in Asia 2023â€™ award!

Ekimetrics is one of the worldâ€™s largest independent analytics firms with offices on 3 continents, and more than 400 data experts. Since 2006, we have led more than a thousand data science projects in over 50 countries, generating more than â‚¬1bn in profit for our customers.

Our difference lies in an integrated approach to performance, and in the desire to reaffirm the value of understanding the business model, which we believe is at the heart of transforming data into new business assets. These sentiments are supported by our company values which serve as pillars in our work and attitude: Curiosity, Creativity, Excellence, Transmission, and Pleasure.

As a Consultant you will be working on challenging projects with international blue-chip clients across diverse industries, on both advanced data analytics and consulting, including meeting with clients and building bespoke solutions to face their challenges. You will be working in teams of 3 to 6 consultants, on 1 to 3 projects simultaneously.Â

Youâ€™ll be able to present your results and will be exposed to C-suite clients.

Youâ€™ll build expertise on several methodologies and industries and develop an exceptional combination of both technical and business skills. You will be accompanied in your learning process through our training program as well as through coaching and mentoring from colleagues. You will have high exposure to each member of our close-knit team, including the Managing Partner in APAC, who is leading the growth of this entity.

Finally, youâ€™ll have the opportunity to both work for a leader in data analytics and have an impact in a strongly growing entity with high ambitions. Each consultant is highly involved in the challenges we are facing and contributes to our passionate, humble and ambitious team.

Your main tasks and responsibilities: âš¡ï¸

Your exact activities will depend on the projects ongoing when joining us, but they will most likely contribute to one or more of the following:

  • Participate in ensuring scalability, time efficiency, ease, satisfaction, and quality of the other teamsâ€™ operations, mainly through building automation and internal tooling using low code tools such as Retool and Make.

  • More specifically, you will have a focus on what we call â€œDelivery Opsâ€: helping our Climate Experts carry out our clientâ€™s GHG Assessments in the most standardized and efficient way possible (internal tool to manage a portfolio of clients and their progress, know when to do what through an internal task management system, provide tools to help them carry out their tasks, give a better overview of each Climate Expertâ€™s workload and each missionâ€™s progress, help them report on what takes the most time,..)

column57:
WANT TO KNOW MORE ABOUT OUR BIG TECH TRANSFORMATION?

Lâ€™OrÃ©al is present in 130 countries on five continents. For more than a century, Lâ€™OrÃ©al has devoted itself solely to one business: beauty; it is now the industry world leader with â‚¬42 billion consolidated sales.

Today, Lâ€™OrÃ©al includes more than 2000 tech positions and itâ€™s constantly growing. Especially with our ambition to become the #1 BeautyTech company, meaning inventing the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

BeautyTech will equip the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic.

To achieve this ambition, Lâ€™OrÃ©al needs to continue recruiting diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

LET US INTRODUCE YOU THE CONTEXT AND MISSIONS!

The Data Integration Solutions Architect is responsible to design data integration solutions within the domain integration to meet the needs of the business. The responsibilities of the Solution Architect include gathering requirements and functional specifications, evaluating existing solution systems to identify areas for improvement.

Ma in missions

  • Collaborate with stakeholders (EA, Project, Integration Ambassador) to understand business requirements and data integration needs.
  • Evaluate and select appropriate pattern and services for data integration.
  • Ensure compliance with Lâ€™OrÃ©al Enterprise Architecture Strategy.
  • Work closely with Integration Solution Ambassador and Integration Platform to ensure that user needs, and feedback are incorporated into solution design and improvements.
  • Analyze Data Integration performances and design improvement
  • Provide technical guidance and mentorship to data integration teams.
  • Support integration project delivery
  • Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in data integration .


Subsidiary missions
  • Contributes to healthcare application integration strategy and implementation in the community.
  • Facilitate training on integration techniques and methods, including creation of documentation for such training


INTERESTED?

THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have :

Pre-requisites:
  • Ex perience in API Concept, programming concepts and Data Integration design patterns.
  • Experience Designing API or Webservices (REST & SOAP)
  • Experience with Event Driven Architecture
  • Experience with architecting complex frameworks.
  • Current understanding of best practices regarding system security measures.
  • Strong Experience on at last one Integration tools of the market (Azure Integration Stack, Mulesoft, Boomi, Kafkaâ€¦.).
  • Strong knowledge on Cloud, SAAS Integration concept (IPaas).
  • Experience with Data Ecosystem (GCP Bigquery, Power BI).
  • Experience in leading technical deliveries (CI/CD) .


Competencies:
  • Demonstrated ability to communicate complex technical information in a condensed manner to various stakeholders verbally and in writing
  • Ability to understand the business and assimilates the overall business strategy of the company, the long-term needs of users/customers.
  • Efficient communication skills.
  • Strong organizational and leadership skills
  • Ability to convert business requirements to business processes and technical designs.
  • Ability to work in a team-based setting and alone in a worldwide environment.
  • Adaptability and willingness to learn new skills, technologies, and frameworks.
  • Leadership experience


Experience:
  • Bachelorâ€™s degree in information technology, software engineering, computer science, or related field.
  • Proven experience in engineering and integration API architecture design.
  • Proven experience in global environment with multicultural stakeholders
  • Proven experience in project management
  • Background in retail, luxe industry is preferred.
  • 7 -10 years in IT function


WAIT, THERE IS MORE! LET US GIVE YOU 4 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining Lâ€™OrÃ©al means joining a company that:

  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Has a powerful and innovative HR policy: a very dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  4. Has chosen to uphold strong values and to be particularly advanced from a social and environmental point of view (strong diversity and inclusion policy, Lâ€™OrÃ©al for the Future program, commitment to numerous communities, etc.).

The Lâ€™OrÃ©al Group is convinced that difference is a deep source of wealth, that allows everyone to grow, to challenge themselves and to go further.

We strongly encourage everyone to always dare and never censor themselves. Skills can always be learnt.

We will be delighted to exchange with you!

Ready to build the future of Lâ€™OrÃ©al together? Apply now!

Unleash Your Potential at Lâ€™OrÃ©alâ€™s Beauty Tech!

For more than a century, Lâ€™OrÃ©al has devoted itself solely to one business: Beauty. Present in 150 countries across five continents and with â‚¬42 billion consolidated sales, Lâ€™OrÃ©al is the global industry leader. With 37 global beauty brands across four divisions, Lâ€™OrÃ©al offers beauty for each covering all beauty categories and catering to all beauty desires. With the acquisition of the Australian brand AÄ“sop in 2023, the Group continues to expand its portfolio through targeted acquisitions as part of its drive to create the future of beauty.

Today, Lâ€™OrÃ©al includes more than 2,000 tech positions and is constantly growing. Beauty Tech is changing the game and leading the shift towards new consumer realities and a digital disruption. Championing Beauty Tech, we invent the beauty of the future while becoming the company of the future.

Beauty Tech is how we know our consumers intimately, augmenting their beauty journeys with unparalleled diverse and sustainable experiences. Beauty Tech equips the Group with the key assets it needs to conquer this new world, where Tech has become strategic. With this ambition, Lâ€™OrÃ©al continues to recruit diverse, innovative, skilled and passionate minds in different tech domains such as Data, Digital, Cloud, Cyber Security, IT Architecture, DevOps, Applications and Infrastructure.

YOUR FUTURE TEAM

Lâ€™OrÃ©al Master Data IT team is still at its early age, but already engaged in significant development and role expansion, bearing major ambitions!

Today, our Team already manage Product and Finance Master Data, globally at Group level, for both our factories and market sales activities, worldwide.

In close partnership with Data & Analytics Governance Organization, we are now engaged in building solutions for more Master Data to be managed at Group level, from various Data Domains, such as, for example, Retail Point of Sales (Commerce), or Websites Repository (Digital Marketing), a list rapidly expanding.

But such initiatives do not only require Master Data Management capabilities and skills: MDs are also requiring Analytics capabilities. It is in this perspective that we are seeking for our Master Data Analytics Lead, accountable for proposing and delivering Analytics solutions contributing to Master Data Management in the following 3 configurations:

  1. In full responsibility for master data consistency & quality checks solutions , use cases triggering MS Power BI on Tibco EBX platform tables (mono source MDM),
  2. In full responsibility also for master data end-to-end interfaces monitoring solutions , use cases requiring MS Power BI on ELK platform (multi-source applications connected to MDM),
  3. In accompaniment of other IT Analytics teams for all their usage of master data and referential in analytics data models serving Analytics Use Cases , on Google Cloud Platform environment.


Join a young & dynamic team: two third of IT Master Data members have been now for less than 2 years in their current position, one fourth of our job positions were newly created within the 2 last years !

What a day in the life of the IT Master Data team looks like:

Reporting directly to IT Master Data Director , as MD Analytics Lead, you will:

  • Coordinate: Represent Master Data Analytics, facing the various Data Domains exercising Data Governance, and their solutions owners as well as their key users spread across many business units / Represent Master Data Analytics, facing other IT teams : Data Factory team in charge of Data Platform, and all other IT teams in charge of MDM source or consuming applications.
  • Organize : Analyze business needs, in collaboration with Applications Owners, for any enhancement or new project subject of Master Data Analytics use cases / Frame and design IT solutions to build as answers to these needs / Participate to the design, the build and the evolution of inbound data processing from sources, the modeling of datamarts and queries, reports & visualizations contributing to these cases / Guarantee global consistency, and respect of Data Factory guidelines for these MD Analytics solutions.
  • Build : Assess and validates expert profiles who will contribute to development and maintenance of MD Analytics / Guarantee development and project management down to deliverables quality and go-live reliability / Ensure respect of plannings, budgets and priorities / Bear responsibility of global consistency of Analytics MD architecture
  • Support: Be responsible for support of Master Data Analytics live solutions / Coordinate the support organization to live users


THIS IS WHAT YOU WILL NEED TO SUCCEED!

First and foremost, we love people that are curious, collaborative, eager to have an impact, proactive and who value innovation, autonomy, and team spirit.

Secondly, in this specific position, it will be important for you to have:

  • An engineer in Information Technology, you have a minimum of 5 years of experience in development, then project management for Analytics or Business Intelligence solutions. You already have proven capability to select and manage BI/Analytics developers, either external or internal, as well as to frame, organize and manage projects in this field.
  • You bring a solid BI/Analytics expertise, based on an effective practice through each of the lifecycle steps of a project [analysis of needs, specifications, development, validation through unitary & volume testing, documentation, support to production go-live until stabilization], experimented on following technologies : Google Cloud platform, Big Query and/or SQL, MS Power BI, data cataloging, data modeling, data analytics processing, data exploration, data querying, data visualization skills (soft and hard).
  • You can exchange fluently in English on your topics in an international context, among people from many nationalities, both orally (phone, videoconference, on-site) and by written (documents, mails, chat)
  • You may bring as an option technical knowledge about SAP Business Object, ELK, TIBCO, Looker, SAP Fiori, APIs.


LET US GIVE YOU 6 OTHER REASONS TO JOIN US!

Joining Lâ€™OrÃ©al means joining a company that:
  1. Invests in Tech and positions its Tech teams at the heart of its digital transformation strategy.
  2. Allows its employees to have a real impact, to test their ideas, to innovate and to build our future.
  3. Offers a Hybrid Work Policy: 3 Days in Office, 2 Days Work from Home
  4. Provides many benefits: VIP staff shop offering our products at a preferential rate, a company restaurant & gym, 60% reimbursement of transportation subscription, a work council offering lots of employee discounts (social & cultural activities, holiday vouchers etc.) and much more!
  5. Provides a powerful and innovative HR policy : dynamic mobility policy, significant investment in employee training, regular re-evaluation of remuneration, numerous innovative HR measures: Time Savings Account, paternity leave, Citizen Day, etc.
  6. Delivers a n Equal Opportunity Employer and take pride in a diverse environment. We would love to find out more about you as a candidate and we do not discriminate in recruitment, hiring, training, promotion, or other employment practices. The beauty we find in our differences gives us the freedom to go beyond. Thatâ€™s the beauty of Lâ€™OrÃ©al.


GOOD TO KNOW: THE RECRUITMENT PROCESS

  2. Interview with the hiring manager
  3. Interview with the business leader


We will be delighted to exchange with you!

column14: IT / Digital, FinTech / InsurTech, Big Data
column28:
Opensee has decided to tackle one of the major challenges facing financial institutions: making the most informed decisions as quickly and easily as possible.

How can they do that? By exploiting all of their data.

Opensee, with its finance and deep tech experts, offers banks and asset managers simple, instant access to their massive data (in Tera) and breaks the status quo:

  • By breaking down silos,
  • By challenging existing processes,
  • By establishing solid partnerships with its customers to develop the most appropriate solutions.

Today, this fast-growing international fintech offers a high-performance solution to major financial institutions in Paris, London and New York.
column36: Junior Implementation Engineer - Big Data & Analytics
column38:
ABOUT OPENSEE

Opensee provides instant big data analytics solutions to financial institutions. Our mission is to empower business users to autonomously exploit data at a scale and granularity never seen before in order to optimize risk management, trade execution, regulatory reporting and more.
Founded in 2015 by senior banking executives and big data technology experts, Openseeâ€™s commercial traction exploded in 2020 with deployment in several Tier 1 financial institutions on critical use cases. To sustain that growth, we doubled our headcount that same year and are now expanding in London, NYC and Singapore.

WHATâ€™S IN IT FOR YOU?

  • Develop expertise in one of the most advanced solution for risk aggregations
  • Work in a dynamic environment where innovation and creativity are highly value
  • Play a key role in strategic projects for international financial institutions
column57:
WHAT ARE YOU GOING TO DO ?

This involves closely working with clientâ€™s internal teams to drive growth and address concerns efficiently:Â 

  • Integrate our solution in client infrastructure, at the multiple steps of the sales process (POC / Test / Production). Clients could use servers, VM, clouds (aws, azure, gcloud), and you must be able, with the help of the teams and our experience, to adapt to that,
  • In charge of data pipeline within Opensee Solution at clients from ingestion to vizualisation,
  • Fine tune the solution to ensure the best performances,
  • Support Client ingesting large quantities of data in a timely manner,
  • Supporting client with every product features,
  • Troubleshoot the system with every problem encountered on all product aspects (deployment, component wealthness, API)Â  during integration project on all client environments ( Staging, UAT, Production)Â 
  • Ensure client production and SLA respect,
  • Manage the SaaS platform offered by Opensee to its clients,

We also have a CLI written in go, to deploy and manage our platform on bare-metal servers and kubernetes (something like aws-cli). Your role will be to improve, expand and stabilize this CLI, that is used by us, and our clients.Y ou will also take part of the Ops part of our infrastructure, that is used for CI/CD/CT and demo.

Keywords: BigData,Â  linux, bash , python pandas, ops, devops, database, docker, kubernetes

column28:
Opensee has decided to tackle one of the major challenges facing financial institutions: making the most informed decisions as quickly and easily as possible.

How can they do that? By exploiting all of their data.

Opensee, with its finance and deep tech experts, offers banks and asset managers simple, instant access to their massive data (in Tera) and breaks the status quo:

  • By breaking down silos,
  • By challenging existing processes,
  • By establishing solid partnerships with its customers to develop the most appropriate solutions.

Today, this fast-growing international fintech offers a high-performance solution to major financial institutions in Paris, London and New York.
